dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – DAY Our attention is concentrated on a sign reading: "THIS IS WHERE IT IS – PARALLEL 38." Below these words, arrows poi to "NORTH KOREA" in one direction, "SOUTH KOREA" in oppos one. Two Air Rescue helicopters are coming in low from th north, descending to a point just outside the entrance to the hospital Admitting Ward. Transferring our attention to the helicopters, our gaze g from the first sign to a second one, on which all we can  read at first are the very large letters: "M-A-S-H." Movi closer to the helicopters as they hit the ground, we can  make out the rest of the sign. Above the four large lette it says: "4077TH," and then we see there is the remainder a word following each of the large letters, but in much  smaller print, so that "M-A-S-H" becomes "Mobile Army Sur Hospital." The helicopters land and enlisted men of the U Army Medical Corps Carry two wounded soldiers from each i the Admitting Ward. LIEUTENANT COLONEL HENRY BLAKE, a permanent member of the Medical Corps and Commanding Officer of the 4077th, watch grimly as the wounded are borne from the helicopters into his hospital. CORPORAL "RADAR" O'REILLY, with a long thin neck, large ears and a knack for anticipating his Colonel wishes, moves up close behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) O'Reilly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at his side) Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Radar, wait till I call you!  Tell Major Burns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the surgeons from the day  shift will have to stay on duty  tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, dammit, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He interrupts himself, frightened by the intense expressi on Radar's face. The Corporal's head is turning back and  forth like an actual radar receiver, monitoring the north horizon where the valley of a river meanders between  mountainous ridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Reilly, what is it? (appalled at the  thought) There aren't more choppers coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got too many wounded for us to  handle now! Get on the phone right  away and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I'll see if I can reach  General Hammond in Seoul for you.  You think he'll finally break down  and give us two more surgeons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DISTANT SOUND of more HELICOPTERS becomes faintly aud to the normal human ear, and a moment later one appears o a ridge.

dialogues.speaker: TIME LAPSE
dialogues.text: EXT. MOTOR POOL AND RAILROAD DEPOT – 325TH EVACUATION  HOSPITAL – YONG-DONG-PA – DAY Two officers come from opposite directions toward a Jeep, each carrying a Valpac and trailing a barracks bag. Thoug they still wear such later-to-be-discarded refinements as captain's bars on their caps and overcoats, they are far  from West Point standards in dress and manner. DUKE, 29, still solidly built like the fullback he once was. HAWKEY 28, a former end, is taller and rangier, wears glasses. T accents, Georgia and Maine respectively, are in sharp  contrast. A MOTOR POOL SARGEANT who has driven the Jeep u climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the guys going to the 4077th?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm one of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (state of Maine  affirmative) Ayuh. I'm the other then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they stow their gear in the back of the Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Hawkeye Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye takes the driver's seat. Duke, getting into the r hand side, has no objection, just a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got directions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayuh, only it's early, I need a drink  to wake me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around and opens his barracks bag, where he find pint bottle conveniently located near the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it yourself, or is it real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia, where I come from, it's  real if you make it yourself. But I  been buying from the Yankee Government  since they put me in this soldier  suit and give me a rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tax-free booze. It's about all you  can say for army life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing bottle) Where you from with that crazy way  of talking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crabapple Cove. Maine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! That must be about as far north  as you can get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty near. What do you know about  the outfit we're going to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.O. is Colonel Blake. Lieutenant  Colonel Henry Braymore Blake. One of  them regular army clowns. Push you  around so it's hard to get any decent  work done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to head them off, right at  the start. Push them around first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have exchanged the bottle a couple of times. In the of raising it to his mouth, Hawkeye looks toward the hosp doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we already caught their eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MPs have emerged from the hospital administration off and are heading toward them. Hawkeye goes into action qui starting the Jeep engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the initials 'MP' stand for,  Hawkeye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shore Patrol, Duke. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep starts off at its maximum takeoff speed and  accelerates dangerously as it careens out of the hospital grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ROAD NEAR OUIJONGBU – DAY Hawkeye and Duke are driving the Jeep along the muddy roa they come upon a sign which fills a large part of the scr "Last chance before Peking". A short distance behind the  sign, it is now revealed are three parked U.S. Army truck in front of which parades a group of Korean prostitutes f fourteen to forty-five. Despite the autumn weather, their costumes, mixed America mail order and Korean, are chosen for seductive appeal ra than warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be the Famous Curb Service Whore  – (pronounced 'howah') House. You in the market Duke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in negation) I done my shopping in Seoul last  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They now have a fairly clear view of a GI and a Korean fe lying in tight formation in the bed on one of the trucks, their activity only partially concealed by a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curb service is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. APPROACH TO 4077TH MASH – DAY Hawkeye stops the Jeep as they come to a place in the roa where they can get a downward look at their future home. river valley in which the 4077th Mash is situated is almo surrounded by mountains. The components of the post are s out in a rough horseshoe with a large compound of level g in the middle. At the closed end of the horseshoe is the  main hospital building, made of wood with a tin roof mark by a large red cross; everything else is canvas. To the l of the main building are strung out the Admitting Ward,  Laboratory, Dental Clinic, Mess Hall, PX, Showers Tent, B Tent and the Enlisted Men's Tents. On the right side are Postop Ward, Officers' Tents, Nurses' Tents, Korean Domes Tents and finally, the Officers' Club. In the f.g., from  Duke and Hawkeye's angle are four helicopters belonging t the 5th Air Rescue Squadron, and the signs we have alread seen marking the post and the 38th Parallel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there it is. Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spot we picked to spend the  winter. Maybe we ought to look a  little harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MASH MESS HALL – DAY As Hawkeye and Duke enter. The large tent has two floor l separated by a railing into a section for officers and on for enlisted men, the two groups being much closer to  numerical equality here than in an ordinary military  installation. There is a further voluntary piece of  segregation within the officers' section: the men – medic officers plus a couple of administrative officers and a  helicopter pilot – are at one long, rectangular table; th nurses, ranging in rank from second lieutenant to captain at another. Hawkeye starts to lead the way to an empty table in the  officers' section, but Duke calls his attention to the  outstanding feature of the nurses' table: LIEUTENANT DISH 24, blonde and clearly, even in her winter fatigues, the  sexiest looking nurse in military history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of that piece of  scenery, Yankee boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finest kind. We'll sit where we can  get the best view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accordingly, they select seats close to the nurses and fa the Lieutenant. Some personnel are on duty in the hospita during this lunch period, but beside Dish, two of the  following three nurses with whom we will become acquainte are present here: KNOCKO, who is black, a captain in her thirties, solidly  built, very strong and very competent in her job; LESLIE, also a captain, not more than thirty, bright, attractive, cheerful, the kind of girl that brings out the latent mal matrimonial instinct but who, strangely, is treated as  inviolate by the by the sex-starved men of the post; and  LIEUTENANT SCORCH, who can't match Dish or Leslie by phys standards but has the asset of instant availability. A Korean boy, not yet of military age, in green fatigue p and an off-white coat, appears promptly and heaps Duke an Hawkeye's plates with food. Duke is hungry enough to turn his whole attention to the meal, but Hawkeye is unable to keep his eyes off Lieutenant Dish while eating. Thus neit of them is aware of the attention they are getting from t male officers' group, which includes HENRY, a couple of  medical captains named MURRHARDT and BANDINI; DAGO RED  (officially, Father John Patrick Mulcahy, red-haired Cath Chaplain of the area) and the PAINLESS POLE (Captain Walt Zaldowski, Dental Officer), both in their thirties; and  CAPTAIN UGLY JOHN BLACK, an Australian anesthesiologist. There is also curiosity about the newcomers from the unli men's section, where we see among others RADAR; VOLLMER,  Henry's overweight Sargeant Major; CORPORAL JUDSON, young black and fresh from Mississippi; PRIVATE BOONE, who look too young and nervous to be in any man's army; and PFC  SEIDMAN, whose first trip out of New York has taken him  halfway around the world. Henry, who alone has reason to be personally affronted by Duke and Hawkeye's unmilitary behavior, gets up and cross to where they are sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Colonel Blake. You fellows just  passing through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, we're assigned heah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With which reminder we will abandon all indications of th Maine accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all were short a couple cutters  and we're what the Army sent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know the first thing you're  supposed to do at a new post is  present yourself to the commanding  officer with your orders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reckon so, but we been boozing all  day and you work up an appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out orders  and handing Duke a  copy) You're welcome to one of these,  whatever they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding his orders) They give you copies to burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry scans both papers to find what he considers the mos important part. There is a RUMBLE OF ARTILLERY in the  distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You've both been working close  to the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listening to artillery) Never this close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've hit us on Cherry Hill. I  just got word. We have our slack  periods but when the action starts,  you'll have more work in twelve hours  than a civilian surgeon does in a  week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Blake, have no fear. Hawkeye  and Duke are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Henry) That's right, pal. You just sit up  front and sign the mail, and leave  the cutting to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may need you to go to work  practically immediately. But meanwhile  perhaps you'd like to meet some of  your fellow officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one for a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blonde dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you mean... (looking toward  Lieutenant Dish) She is a lieutenant in the Army  Nursing Corps, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Lieutenant Dish. I guess she's  already... involved with somebody  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've all tried. Nobody's got to  first base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is interrupted by the fact that Dish and Knocko have r from their table and are passing right by them on their w to the door. The Lieutenant has just as nice a walk as you would hope  for, and the men's eyes follow her till she is again out hearing distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why bother with first base? I'd go  right for the home run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Painless Pole and Dago Red have come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the new talent, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Pierce, Captain Forrest...  Father Mulcahy, the Catholic Chaplain  of the area, and Captain Waldowski,  our Dental Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better known as Painless Pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murrhardt and Bandini come over and all ADLIB introductio – asking each other their backgrounds, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all call him Dago Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Duke and he's Hawkeye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to know you. Drop in at my clinic  anytime you feel like playing a little  poker, or even if a tooth is bothering  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poker sounds great. When do you play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said anytime. Day and night, seven  days a week. The players change but  the game never stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye and Duke) You'll be living with Major Burns.  O'Reilly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before his name is uttered, Radar has already risen from enlisted men's group, and is now at Henry's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that, Radar! You make me  nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come so quickly when I call. I  want you to take these officers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Major Burns' tent. Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that, O'Rielly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. / INT. "THE SWAMP" (PRESENTLY FRANK'S TENT) – DAY Hawkeye and Duke drag their bags from the Jeep, which Rad drives away. They look over their new residence, a standa army tent, square with peaked roof, a wooden door attache to the canvas. Then as they approach it, they become awar of a youthful Korean voice reading, in heavily accented  English, words that have no meaning for the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Yea, though I walk through the valley  of the shadow of death... '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of his ancestors, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I shall fear no evil for Thou art  with me...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open the door of the tent and go in. There are three canvas cots with sleeping bags on them, a plank floor, an oil stove, electric light, a few crude shelves, one table and one chair plus assorted crates serving as same. MAJOR FRANK BURNS, 35, from Wisconsin, is sitting on one the two more favorably situated cots listening to HO-JON, Korean boy of 16, read from the Bible. He corrects the wo that has given Ho-Jon the most trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thou. For Thou art with me. (sees Duke and Hawkeye,  jumps up) Welcome, welcome, welcome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ho-Jon, my houseboy. Our  houseboy. I'm teaching him English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he gonna use that kind of  talk? 'The valley of the shadow of  death.' Wait a minute, Ho-Jon... (rummages in barracks  bag) I got something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out sex magazine, gives it to Ho-Jon in such a w that we see the nude on the cover, but Frank doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank) Little light reading matter. Just  right for his age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Duke) Well, southern boy, I suppose you  want the sack that's convenient to  the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And gets the wind every time it opens.  No, thanks. I'll take that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the unoccupied cot which, like Frank's, is a the rear of the tent with the stove between it and the fr door. Hawkeye shrugs and reaches into his barracks bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's choose for it. (finds baseball bat,  hands it to Duke) You toss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke tosses the bat vertically in the air. As it comes do Hawkeye grabs it expertly at the tape with his left hand. Duke puts his left hand above that, and Duke is left with his right hand waving in the air with nothing to grab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ho-Jon) Part of your education. Always use  your own bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses Valpac onto the desired cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ADMITTING WARD – NIGHT It's pretty full already and more wounded are being broug in by corpsmen. In contrast to the opening scene, where t casualties were a generalized fact seen at a distance, in this scene they are viewed individually and at close rang and the effect, both on the eye and the ear, is almost  unbearable. Hawkeye, in a white gown as are all the surge and nurses, moves from a patient he has just examined to who is letting out a number of unintelligible SOUNDS mixe in with such clear and frequently repeated words as "Chri "Mother," "God damn" and "Please." As Hawkeye approaches, Lieutenant Scorch removes enough of the bandaging done in the field to display an abdomen with part of its contents the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-man job. How much blood has he  had?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second pint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke has just examined a patient. He takes a step towards Hawkeye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid's ready but we won't know  all the damage till we get in and  see what's happened. What have you  got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing can't wait. Shall we check  it out with the Major?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates a Major who is standing a short distance awa looking like a boss but not actually doing anything. Also Admitting Ward are, Murrhardt, Lieutenant Dish, PFC Seidm Corporal Judson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I already found out. The only  thing he doesn't like about being in  charge is making decisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT NOTE: All principal cast should be available for all oper scenes. There are three operations going on at once. Here all  personnel wear white caps and masks and it is hard to ide individuals except that at close range we can distinguish Hawkeye by his glasses and Duke by his eyes and his build They are working together with great efficiency and an  instinctive collaboration that seems to require no verbal exchange. What we see them do, without necessarily recogn the portion of anatomy involved, is to cut out a section bowel damaged by a shell fragment, and start sewing the  divided ends together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye and Duke are working together on the last stages a leg amputation. This time there is no doubt about the  surgical process we are watching; we see the almost sever leg and the process of controlling bleeding; then the lim is actually separated from its stump and handed by Duke t corpsman. Hawkeye speaks to the nurse standing behind him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching her dip the pack into a warm solution and wring out, he recognizes, despite cap and mask, that it is  Lieutenant Dish. His eyes linger on hers for a brief mome

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. OUTSIDE OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Lieutenant Dish comes out of the Operating Room, tears in her eyes, trying to control her sobs, and moves just outs the circle of light from the fixture over the entrance. T no longer under observation, she lets herself cry. Hawkey comes out the door, registers surprise at the sight of he just as if he hadn't followed her out. He moves to her si and puts a comforting arm around her. She looks up just long enough to see who it is, then buri her head on his shoulder as his other arm goes around her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this ridiculous, Doctor? Six  months I've been here and there are  still times when I can't stand it. I  just go to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing ridiculous about it. (turns her face up to  his) A kid like you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't move her head from the way he has arranged it and her lips are very close to his. He kisses her and it  turns out, from the ardent way she responds, that's what wanted him to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain Pierce. (her voice full of  need) It's been so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble at all. (then) Hawkeye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get called that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Last of the Mohicans.' Only  book my father ever read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her again and again she clings to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting a workout, you and  Captain Forrest, your first night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't always this rough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. We have dull stretches every  week or so, thank God, when there's  nothing to do after midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have to be dull. I mean  if you and me put our minds  together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our minds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a start. I just have a hunch...  well, it isn't entirely a hunch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an attractive man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a certain modest charm  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing her own  thoughts) But I'm married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something else we have in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very happily married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And absolutely determined to be  faithful to my husband. Do we have  that in common, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a matter of definition. Faithful  in spirit, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't make the distinction. But  the sex urge is a powerful force. In  women just as much as men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ayuh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think now, with only six weeks  before they ship me back home, it  would be easier. But it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's terribly hard. Sometimes the  temptation is just too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why not, as long as it wouldn't  hurt anybody...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not hearing him,  just continuing her  own thought) But you've made me feel strong again,  Captain. Hawkeye. (smiling, tears gone,  ready to return to  work) You helped me pull together when I  needed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a grateful look at him, she goes back inside. Hawkey contemplates the accomplishment she has credited him with and finds it appalling. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye and Duke are working across the table from each o again, this time inside a man's chest, stopping a hemorrh and debriding the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's what I call real pretty.  We can close up here and go into his  belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't take much more time on the  table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we got to cut him fast. I figure  from the X-ray it ain't just the  spleen. We also got to snatch his  right kidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MASH COMPOUND – MORNING Wearing fatigues now, Hawkeye and Duke are making their w way from the hospital to their tent after a night's work. There is an announcement coming over the post-wide public address system, but it doesn't concern them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P.A.) Captain Murrhardt, please report to  the Colonel's office at the earliest  opportunity. Captain Murrhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. THE SWAMP – MORNING Ho-Jon throws a match into the oil stove, but it doesn't  work. He looks into it, strikes another match, and this t it lights up so quickly he is almost singed by the flame. Hawkeye and Duke open the door and come in. Ho-Jon straig and bows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Captain Pierce and  Captain Forrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can cut the bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not understood what you means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demonstrating bow) That. It's out of the act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Duke remove their outer clothing during the ensuin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because is not democrash? All peoples  created equal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you been sneaking some reading  outside the frigging Bible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have great interest for America,  his peoples and his custom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, because we got a fine old  American custom we want to teach  you. You know what these are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives Ho-Jon two bottles. The boy looks at the labels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gin. I know, yes. (reads other label) Dry... (has trouble with the  word) ...vermouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MASH COMPOUND – MORNING Frank walks toward the tent from the direction of the  hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. THE SWAMP – MORNING Frank opens the door and is taken aback by the sight of t two bottles on the table and Ho-Jon filling glasses held Duke and Hawkeye, who have climbed into their sleeping ba He is so disturbed he fails to shut the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that liquor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finest kind. We're training Ho-Jon  to be a bartender. Join us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first will you please kindly  shut the goddam door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink intoxicants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Duke) Christ Almighty, I think he means  it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it's right for you  to involve a boy who's not seventeen  years old yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door, Frank, the door! Where you  from anyhow, Alaska?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closing door) Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same general idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank proceeds to take off his outer clothing preparatory retiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer all sleep now, yes? And I go  wash clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Ho-Jon. See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Ho-Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make a mean martini, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon goes out. Duke and Hawkeye settle back to enjoy th drinks but they both come bolt upright when they see Fran drop to his knees by his cot and begin to intone the Lord Prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Father who art in Heaven Hallow'd  be Thy name. Thy kingdom come, Thy  will be done, On earth as it is in  Heaven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye and Duke find it hard to believe their eyes and e They never expected to see a grown man behaving as Frank now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us this day our daily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever caught this bread, and  forgive our syndrome before, Duke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...trespasses as we forgive those  who trespass against...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us. Lead us not into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...No cases over the age of temptation  but deliver us eight. from evil. For  Thine is the kingdom, the power and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the glory forever. Amen. (raising martini  glasses) Amen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Onward Christian soldiers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Marching as to war. With the cross  of Jesus going on before. Christ our  Royal Master, leads against the foe.  Forward into battle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking off singing,  points to Frank) He ain't finished!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, before Hawkeye speaks, some of the words Fr is mumbling come through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And for our young men on the field  of battle, that they may return home  to their dear ones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come clean with us, Frank. Were you  on this religious kick back home, or  did you start to crack up here on  the post?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) ...And for our Supreme Commander  over here and our Commander-in-Chief  in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long does the show go on, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank turns his head toward Duke while remaining in prayi position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets longer all the time. Now I  have your soul to pray for, and  Captain Pierce's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HENRY'S OUTER OFFICE – DAY Sargeant Vollmer is working on some papers at his desk wh Hawkeye and Duke come in. They pass right by him and head for Henry's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! That's a Colonel's office!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand on Henry's door) Ayuh. Just who we're looking for. (opens door) Henry, you got to do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LESLIE exits from Henry's office as they enter. INT. HENRY'S OFFICE – DAY Henry is at his desk. Duke and Hawkeye come in and seat  themselves in informal comfort. Both watch Leslie exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've stuck it out for a whole week  now... Pretty girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure don't aim to cause any  trouble... Yeah, she seems to grow  on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't aim to cause any trouble –  But?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we strongly suspect something  will happen to screw up this splendid  organization of yours if you don't  get that sky pilot out of our tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your tent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe move that nurse in. She  don't seem the type to keep you awake  praying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I have been in this Army a long time.  I know just what you guys are up to.  But there are limits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find out what they are when  you throw us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all the commitment you're  offering me? (to Duke) Or do you have some more extravagant  gesture of cooperation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Hawkeye just said it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except we forgot one other small  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chest-cutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. (to Henry) You better get us a chest-cutter  before there's trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This outfit needs somebody who can  find his way around the pulmonary  anatomy when the bases are loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's the ninth inning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. No Mash unit has a chest  surgeon and we aren't about to get  one. Your housing problem I'll give  some thought to in the next couple  of weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar O'Reilly comes in with "Emergency" written all over his expressive face. He makes a hand gesture to Henry tha could loosely be construed as a salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, O'Reilly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you, Radar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're running behind in the OR,  sir, and the Preop Ward is all jammed  up. Two choppers and three ambulances  full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the most serious kind of crisis for the outfit, a Henry's expression shows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Duke and Hawkeye) You boys'll have to go to work early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fixing to add overtime to a twelve- hour day? The union ain't gonna like  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work those kind of hours, you  got to have rest. Which you can't  get with somebody jabbering away on  a direct line to heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crisply) Major Burns will be out of your tent  in twenty-four hours. (to Radar) Tell them Captain Pierce and Captain  Forrest are on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar goes out. Duke gets to his feet and Hawkeye makes a preliminary move toward doing so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About that chest-cutter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try, d-d-dammit! You can't ask  any more than that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want any more than that. (following Duke out) Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MASH COMPOUND – DUSK Hawkeye and Lieutenant Dish are walking close together in otherwise deserted area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts an arm around her without waiting for an answer. smiles at him fondly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if I weren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her and they cling together, standing outside a tent identified by a sign: "OFFICER'S CLUB."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Hawkeye, I don't think I could  stick it out these next few weeks  without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye opens the door of the Officers' Club, looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps aside to let her precede him in. There is nothin inside except a pool table. She hesitates. He takes her i his arms again, this time pressing his hands against the  seat of her fatigue pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand why I still can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon appears in his line of vision, not hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Pierces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye lets go of her, and they try to look like innocen strollers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ho-Jon. How they goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finest kind. Captain Forrests say  you better haul ass home quick. We  got new chest-cutter in our tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. THE SWAMP – DUSK The wooden front of the tent has a new sign identifying i as "THE SWAMP." INT. THE SWAMP – DUSK First we see Hawkeye sitting on his cot, looking across t tent at the newcomer. Attached to the canvas wall behind is a photograph of his wife and two sons, aged four and t Next we turn our attention to Duke on the adjoining cot  (formerly Frank's). He also has a family picture on displ his wife, two-year-old daughter and an infant. Then we ge our first glimpse of TRAPPER JOHN, their new tentmate, ab 30, tall and very thin, his head pretty well hidden insid the hood of a parka. He is using cellophane tape to insta one of the popular nude photos of the day (such as the on of Marilyn Monroe that circulated so widely in the early  1950's). Completing the group is Ho-Jon, who sits on the floor,  silently taking in everything that is done or said. Finished with his decorating effort, Trapper reaches into the depths of his parka to produce a can of beer. He digs into the other side, finds an opener and opens the beer.  Then his head goes back inside the parka along with the c as he takes a swig from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye) Now I got you for a witness, I'm  going to try again. So far all I  dragged out of him is he's from  Bahston and he's only been in the  Army two months. (to Trapper) Where were you when they drafted  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what were you doing? Were  you a resident or on a staff  someplace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any reason why we shouldn't  know the name of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (a long swig of beer) Or why you should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Duke) I think I've seen this nut somewhere. (to Trapper) Haven't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't know what you've seen,  why should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye is unsatisfied. He keeps staring at Trapper, sure he's seen him before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trapper) You ready to switch to a little tonic  we generally take us about this time?  Ho-Jon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon goes to the table and takes a few ice cubes from a hospital ice-bag, puts them into the pitcher along with g and a dash of vermouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you use olives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you think you are, boy? They  probably never seen a olive in this  country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon pours three water-glasses full of martini and star to distribute them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trapper) That's the front up the road a few  miles. We have to get by without  some of the comforts of home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like an olive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his parka, comes up with a bottle of oliv takes one out and puts it into the martini Ho-Jon serves  him. Then, as Hawkeye and Duke gape at him, he offers the the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY There are two operations going on, one of them being a si procedure requiring one surgeon and one nurse. The other contrast is a very special event. Trapper is operating,  assisted by another surgeon, a couple of nurses, a corpsm and the anesthesiologist, UGLY JOHN BLACK. Beside these a participants almost all the nurses and doctors from both  shifts, including Duke, Hawkeye (with Lieutenant Dish), F and Henry, are in a circle around the operating table as  spectators. Trapper's job is repairing a lacerated pulmonary artery, some other delicate piece of surgery close to the heart a involving a large chest incision. We see enough of the pr to observe that it is gory and deep inside a critical are but necessarily it is the reactions of the people watchin especially Duke and Hawkeye, that tell us how tricky an  operation it is and how expertly Trapper is handling it. The sequence is silent except for incidental operating ro noises. Even Trapper's occasional terse instructions to his assis and his brief exchange with Ugly John are spoken too low us to hear. There are four stages to the action: 1. The beginning of the operation before an attentive  audience, drawn by their interest in the new man and by t fact that this is a surgical procedure they have never da to attempt. 2. Limited approval and professional respect for the assu with which Trapper plots his incision and starts working way to his destination. 3. Mounting tension as the crucial stage is reached. The  suspense reaches its crest during the few moments when Tr is doing the actual mending job to which all the prelimin have led. The faces of his colleagues express anxiety and hope that he can accomplish what he set out to do, and  accomplish it quickly enough to permit the patient to sur Henry, not certain of his own judgment, looks to Duke for confirmation, and Duke nods to indicate he thinks Trapper has the situation under control. 4. The tension breaks as Trapper finishes the job to his  satisfaction and begins, along with his assistant surgeon to close up. Henry's smile of relief is unsure and only  tentative until he catches Hawkeye's signal that the job been done to perfection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MASH COMPOUND – DAY Trapper, Hawkeye and Duke emerge from the hospital in  fatigues. Some enlisted men are tossing a football around One of them makes a wild throw and the ball rolls to a st at Trapper's feet. He stops to look at it and the other t halt with him. Then very slowly, Trapper leans over and p up the ball, waving Hawkeye downfield. Hawkeye complies unquestioningly and when he is about thi yards away, Trapper whips a perfect pass into his arms.  Hawkeye just stands where he is, holding the ball, oblivi of the enlisted men who want it back, as Trapper and Duke continue toward him. Revelation jolts him with apocalyptic force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus to Jesus and eight hands around!  Duke, did I ever tell you how I beat  Dartmouth by intercepting a pass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't have a chance, little  Androscoggin College against the Big  Green, but there was this blizzard  and we held then nothing nothing  till the last twenty seconds. Then  this great passer of theirs let one  go, snow and all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky you didn't have your mouth  open or it would have gone down your  throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Trapper John! Only man in history  who ever found fulfillment in the  ladies' can of a Boston and Maine  Railroad car! When the Conductor  caught him in there with his Winter  Carnival date, she screamed: 'He  trapped me!' What have you been doing  since those days, Trapper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he have to do? A score  like that, a man could just live on  his reputation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enlisted men, increasingly concerned about their foot are muttering mutinously to each other. Hawkeye is too ca away about Trapper's identity to notice this till Trapper calls it to his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye) Ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye looks at the football and at the enlisted men, an finally getting the point, throws it back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved to find  another subject) What gives over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look across the compound to the Shower Tent, behind  which an Army truck full of GIs has just pulled up. While Hawkeye and Duke explain what's going on to Trapper, and three of them move in for a closer look, we see the visit GIs drop one by one from the rear of the truck, pay their admission fees and take their places in the line leading to the strategically placed peep hole in the rear corner the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be Painlees Pole Day in the  Shower Tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trapper) You met him. Walt Waldowski, the  Dental Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice guy, for an enamel surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they peeking at? Captain  Waldowski in the shower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of him. Painless is the owner  and operator of the Pride of Hamtrack.  That's where he comes from...  Hamtrack, Michigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best equipped dentist in the whole  goddam Army. Care to have a look, a  man with your background?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way we hear it, the Pride is supposed  to have run up the highest lifetime  batting average ever recorded in  Wayne County.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. SHOWER TENT – DAY Corporal Judson from Mississippi takes his turn at the  peephole. His speech is that of the rural southern black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah'd purely love to see it angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye and Duke are working on a patient about whose cha their faces reveal extreme pessimism. The nurse in attend is Leslie. Hawkeye takes the patient's blood pressure and frowns at reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid looks like a loser. Maybe  we better get the bead-jiggler to  put in a fix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Leslie) Call Dago Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Without interfering with the administration of blood and  other medical measures, Dago Red is just finishing giving last rites to the patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...May God remit unto thee the pains  of the present and future life, open  to thee the gates of heaven, and  bring thee to everlasting life. (makes the sign of  the Cross) May Almighty God bless thee, Father,  Son and Holy Ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking patient's  pulse) Duke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants him to feel it and he does, reacting excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowing down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye meanwhile is checking blood pressure again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going up. Nice work, Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. THE SWAMP – DAY Dago Red is the cocktail guest of the three Swampmen. Ho- sits in his usual place on the floor, following everythin that's said and refilling martini glasses wherever needed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's sort of a built-in prayer  for the sick man to get well, but of  course that's not the basic intention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about the intention. I  just know your Cross Action is a  plus on our side. I've seen it come  through four times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've had a natural four times  in a row in a crap game. Right? Does  that mean...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not without lots of praying and  kissing the dice. (to Dago Red) It's a different ritual but it works  the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Trapper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I was raised a mackerel-snapper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dago Red gives him a quick, intent look, which Hawkeye no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But I turned in my knee pads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon, give the Father some more  martini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a taste, Ho-Jon. (to the group) I'd better get to the point... what  I came here for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came because we asked you, for a  drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanted to tell you how you were  helping us with your fixes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sure, but I'm also worried  about Walt Waldowski – Painless. His  poker players got in an argument and  asked him for a ruling, and he said  what difference did it make, it was  just a card game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's obvious from the shocked reactions of the Swampmen t the priest couldn't have reported a more ominous symptom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm getting a toothache I  better have looked at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DENTAL CLINIC – DAY There is no activity around the dental chair, but the non poker game is thriving as Hawkeye enters, carrying a bott in a paper bag. The players are evenly divided between  officers (UGLY JOHN, MURRHARDT and a visiting HELICOPTER  PILOT) and enlisted men (VOLLMER, RADAR and JUDSON).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a seat, Hawk. We can use a fresh  pigeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to see the man about a tooth.  Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vollmer) Call. With a pair of kings. (to Hawkeye, pointing  to smaller tent  attached) Inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye goes on into Painless' private quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignantly, to Radar) How can you call with one lousy pair?  Ought to be a house rule against  mind reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. PAINLESS' TENT – DAY Painless is lying on his back on the cot, staring blankly the ceiling. Hawkeye has poured drinks from his bottle an is sipping his, but Painless' remains untouched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a man isn't a man anymore, what's  he got left to live for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the whole story, Walt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this native broad works in  the laundry. I don't know if you've  noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one worth noticing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You noticed. I wasn't going to fool  around over here. I've got these  three girls I'm engaged to back  home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates three photographs of young women, displayed  with equal prominence. Any one of them could make Miss  America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I had this feeling I ought to  make the effort. To test myself. And  I flunked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you have to test, for God's  sake... the dental Don Juan of  Detroit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Juanism is just a cover... I've  been reading up on it. (emotionally overcome,  turning away) I'm a fake, I'm a fraud, I've been  living a lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moved by the intensity of his self-denunciation, Hawkeye  bends down close to Painless, puts a comforting hand on h shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painless, you mustn't talk that way.  It's a lot of crap. Cover for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homosexuality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye straightens abruptly, his hand rising from Painle shoulder as from a hot stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know that's been my problem  since I was a kid. But it only caught  up to me last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been drawn to other males?  Since you were a kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, never in the slightest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or in dreams either. I repressed it  completely. Classic pattern of  inhibition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you've been doing all  these years with every dame you could  lay your hands on? Repressing your  real self?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's all over now, and I can't  face it. Imagine if you found out  you were one, you wouldn't like  breaking the news to your wife. Well,  I got the same problem multiplied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have any problem. You've  got thirty good years ahead of you,  easy. Maybe you'll have to cut down  as you grow older, get along with  just two fiancees, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, one thing I finally know for  sure, I'll never function with a  woman again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. THE SWAMP – NIGHT Hawkeye is reporting to Duke and Trapper. Murrhardt and  Bandini are there, as well as Ho-Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ought to be a law against  dentists reading. Matter of fact, I  thought there was. Anyway, this is  an obsession. He can't be persuaded  out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appearing in doorway) He's comin' this-a-way! The jaw- breaker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all just act natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out the scotch, Ho-Jon. (to the others) Don't mention the sex thing unless  he brings it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfunctory knock on the door is immediately followed b the entrance of Painless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you, Walt? We was just fixing to  have a nightcap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ho-Jon) Pour one for Painless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon serves drinks all around. There is a silence as ea of the hosts tries to think of a conversational opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you guys ought to know.  I'm going to commit suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This leads to another silence, broken by Trapper, who doe go so far as to stand up but leans way out from his sack grasp the dentist by the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss you, Walt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it for us all, Walt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about leaving me your record  player?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you figure to go? Forty-five  between the eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powerful sloppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reliable though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really what I came here for.  See what you guys recommend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as in a medical  consultation) Well, I'm sure my colleagues will  agree there are a number of dependable  measures for extinguishing the vital  forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black capsule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black capsule. Finest kind. Thank  you, Dr. McIntyre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, pleasant, never-miss ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the direction you want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys got any black capsules?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a buddy we got whatever it takes  to stamp out the last spark of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DAGO RED'S TENT – DAY The priest is sitting at his desk reading his breviary wh Hawkeye and Trapper enter. Trapper goes over to Red's bee supply, opens it and distributes three cans while Hawkeye greets their host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How they goin', Losing Preacher?  What do you hear from the Pope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked to Walt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's parted his moorings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're throwing him a Last Supper. We  came to invite you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Painless Pole plans to cross the  Great Divide tonight and we need  your help to straighten him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put in one of your fixes. Walt knows  he's loused himself with the Church,  but it's part of our plan to make  him think he has the keys to the  kingdom. Which he will think if you  grease the skids for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I can give absolution  to a man who's about to commit  suicide. It's a mortal sin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is, Red, the intention or the  act?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) I believe it takes both. I'd have to  look it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just use common sense. Your job is  preventing sin, and the way to do  that is give him your best Cross  Action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you can let him knock himself  out. You personally'd be sending him  to his grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eternal damnation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling cornered) I don't know. I'm not sure what the  Military Vicar's office would think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sure as hell won't hear about  it from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DENTAL CLINIC – NIGHT The poker table, and dental chair have been removed to ma room for two long tables from the Mess Hall. At these a  sumptuous, candlelit, stag banquet is coming to an end. T guests are doctors, administrative officers, chopper pilo and enlisted men. Duke is on his feet, raising a glass of champagne in a toast. (All our male cast except Henry and Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all come here to say a final goodbye  to our old friend Walt. But maybe it  ain't so final. Maybe he's just going  on ahead into the Unknown to do a  little recon job for us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this tribute the guests rise, their eyes on the gu of honor, who sits with his food untouched, a vacant  expression on his face. When Duke has finished and everyo has drunk the toast, they applaud and sit down again. Tra raps for attention and indicates Hawkeye, who rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got this one thing to say.  Nobody ordered Walt to take on this  mission. He volunteered, for certain  death. That's what we award our  highest medal for. That's what being  a soldier is all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for Painless himself, the gathering is deeply move by this thought, some of them to the point of tears. Agai Trapper restores order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one man here can add anything  to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to Dago Red, who stands up, dressed for the firs time in the priestly vestments he wears for Sunday Mass. walks to where Painless sits and there begins the viaticu (holy communion for those in danger of death).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Receive, my brother, this food for  your journey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coffin, borne into the room by two enlisted men while R is still speaking, is lined with blankets, equipped with pillow for comfortable reclining prior to the onset of de and furnished with mementos of Painless' earthly career: fresh decks of cards, a box of poker chips, a fifth of sc some basic dental instruments and the photographs of his  three fiancees. It is set down on the floor next to Painl who regards it with the first show of interest he has  manifested during the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bestowing the sacred  host) ...The body of our Lord Jesus Christ,  that He may guard you from the wicked  enemy and lead you into everlasting  life. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red is making the sign of the Cross when Painless' curios asserts itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffin. Yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even dead yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a pretty heavy guy to lug  around. Be a hell of a lot more  convenient for everybody if you got  into the box as soon as you've taken  the capsule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He produces and opens a small box, inside which, surround by pure white cotton, a black capsule is displayed like a rare jewel. Dago Red, meanwhile, preferring not to know w happens from here on, makes his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scrutinizing the  capsule) How do you take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appearing at his  side with tumbler of  whiskey) With whiskey. A good swallow first  and a big one afterwards. Speeds it  into the bloodstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painless takes the tumbler from him with one hand, the ca with the other. He downs a good-sized swig of whiskey, th with the capsule in front of his face, hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys sure this'll do the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't give you nothing but the  best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stand behind all our work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it straight? Medical history  records no instance of anyone taking  this particular prescription and  surviving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here goes nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the capsule into his mouth and washes it down wit large drink of whiskey. Hawkeye gestures to the waiting  coffin. Painless gets up and lowers himself into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time do I have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just about enough to say goodbye to  everybody. (announcing) Line up over here, men, if you want  to pay your last respects. Keep moving  and file on out when you're through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder, if Red's fix swings it for  me, what's heaven really like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bedroom where a man is always  at his peak and doesn't have to take  any time outs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the angels are built like  Lieutenant Dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Last Supper guests are filing by the coffin, bending to shake Painless' hand and murmur words of farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up, Walt. One for the glory  road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the glass to Painless' lips, helps him down the  rest of the whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. POSTOP WARD – NIGHT Hawkeye finishes checking a patient, looks to doorway and sees lieutenant Dish standing there. He crosses to join h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming, Maria. (takes her arm and  leads her through  exit) Sorry it had to be so late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MASH COMPOUND – NIGHT Hawkeye and Lieutenant Dish walk from the Postop Ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't have slept tonight anyhow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In less than twelve hours I'll be on  my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when the real strain starts.  Three weeks on a troopship. (embraces her) Poor baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing him) Dear, sweet Hawkeye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though I guess who it'll really be  rough on is your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on his side all of the sudden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man would be more considerate. He  wouldn't come home to his wife a  nervous wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would he avoid it... as if I  needed to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be a purely impersonal thing.  What matters is the therapeutic value  of relieving your tensions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have been a marriage  counselor. (drawing his head  closer to hers) But I'll show you what's wrong with  your theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss passionately. Dish is shaken by it and that sho in her voice when she continues making her point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think anything between us  could be impersonal? Or pure? You  better forget logic, because you're  proving why I shouldn't go to bed  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment of  massive internal  struggle) I didn't mean with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a couple of seconds for what he has said to pene her consciousness. She looks at him incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking for somebody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens to be a matter of life  and death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man is going to die if he doesn't  have my fair young body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely, Maria. Tonight you have  the same privilege that comes on  rare occasions to the chief executive  of some state or nation... the  privilege of restoring life, by one  tender act of mercy, to a doomed  fellow creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he is speaking, a blue light goes on in a tent in t background. As they turn to see what is going on, four me carrying a heavy box approach the tent. EXT. BLUE-LIT TENT – NIGHT (OFFICER'S CLUB) At closer range the box is revealed to be Painless' coffi with the departed dentist inside it. The four men who car it into the tent are Radar, Judson, Boone and Seidman. Th tent doesn't have a wooden door like the Swamp, just a fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. BLUE-LIT TENT – NIGHT The four enlisted men carry the coffin, empty, out of the tent. Then Hawkeye and Dish appear, moving slowly toward tent as he continues to break down her resistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should come to now for a while,  but he's got so much dope in him by  tomorrow he won't know fact from  fantasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care? You'll be on your  way to Japan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fond of Painless, and I'd feel  terrible if anything happened to  him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your decision, Maria. I don't  want to high-pressure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be crazy to think my virtue,  such as it is, was more important  than his life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact I'd rather not try to  influence you at all. (opening tent flap) Let's just go in and take a look,  and then you think it through for  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. BLUE-LIT TENT – NIGHT The tent has been fixed up with all the resources at thei disposal – cushions, parachute cloth, mirrors and little  touches of elegance gathered from all over the post – to  resemble a luxurious bedroom on the home front. Lying in (the pool table) between clean, inviting sheets is Painle The boys have undressed him as we can see by his bare  shoulders. Hawkeye takes Dish by the hand and leads her t the side of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last look at him... (raises sheet,  uncovering Painless  to the knees) ...still alive... (slips raised sheet  into Dish's grasp) ...the whole man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dish's eyes pop at what she sees. So astounded is she tha she doesn't notice Hawkeye has given her the sheet and ma off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Hawkeye, I never realized...  I never even dreamed... (becoming aware he's  no longer at her  side) Hawkeye! Hawk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds he's disappeared altogether. She can't resist  turning her gaze back to the uncovered Painless. Then she drops the sheet. EXT. BLUE-LIT TENT – NIGHT The tent flap drops into place, continuing the movement o the sheet. Our attention is drawn up the front of the ten to its peak, which points firmly upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. THE SWAMP – MORNING There is the SOUND of a HELICOPTER overhead. Hawkeye emer from the tent to look at it, verifying that it is coming  from the peaceful south rather than the embattled north.  Then he sees Lieutenant Dish coming out of her tent, wear her Army uniform and followed by one of the enlisted men  carrying her bags. Hawkeye waves goodbye but Dish doesn't see him. Her face, seen up close, has a serene, faraway l neither happy nor unhappy, but enriched by experience. Hawkeye is not distressed by her failure to acknowledge h he understands it's a question of preoccupation and not a deliberate snub. He starts across the compound to the Mes Hall, noting that the helicopter is descending to land on the far side of the hospital. EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – MORNING There is a small welcoming party on hand, headed by Henry himself, to greet the passenger arriving in the helicopte When it lands the door is opened and HOT LIPS (as she wil soon be known) gets out smartly, which is the way she doe everything. Her official name is Major Margaret Houlihan she is tallish, willowish, blondish, fortyish, prettyish. She and Henry exchange salutes and then shake hands. The  others in the greeting party are out of the habit of salu and have to be reminded by a stern look from their Comman Officer. As Henry and Hot Lips, followed by the others, head for t hospital entrance, Lieutenant Dish appears with the enlis man behind her. She gets into the helicopter and he lifts her bags in aft her. A moment later the chopper is airborne again. INT. MESS HALL – DAY One of the first people Hawkeye sees in the officer's sec is Painless, who is eating an enormous breakfast with gre gusto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning Painless. How they goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big day. Two jaws to rebuild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. POSTOP WARD – DAY Frank is listening gravely to a wounded soldier's heartbe through a stethoscope. Standing by awaiting orders is Pri Boone. Frank has a disturbed reaction to the lack of vita signs from the patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Boone) Get me one c.c. of adrenaline and a  cardiac needle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind questions. Get them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Boone dashes off with no comprehension of the errand h is supposed to perform, Trapper, a couple of beds away, i the soiled fatigues he wears on nonoperating room duty, c see and hear what is going on. While he watches, Frank ch the patient further and establishes that he is dead. With disappointed sigh, he drops the man's lifeless arm and th the bedcovers back over him up to his neck. INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY Henry is showing Hot Lips through the hospital and introd her to personnel. At the moment he is presenting Knocko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Williams, Major. (to Knocko) Major Houlihan is our new Chief Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knocko holds out her hand in friendly greeting, and is  startled to find Hot Lips expects a salute instead. INT. POSTOP WARD – DAY Trapper, having observed Frank's recognition of the fact patient is dead, is unprepared for what the Major does wh Boone comes running back with a syringe, a small vial and ordinary hypodermic needle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously) This what you wanted, Major?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at vial) No, you idiot. I said adrenaline.  And a cardiac needle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the patient and goes all over again thro the same checking process he followed before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) I'll ask a nurse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late. You killed him, Boone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ghastly look appears on Boone's face. He tries to say  something, can't get it out, and bursts into tears instea Then additionally ashamed of himself for this weakness, h runs out. Frank, deciding not to discipline the boy for t display of unsoldierly conduct, is proceeding about his  business when Trapper accosts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a moment, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the Utility Room, which leads off the Operat Room and the Postop Ward. When Frank assents, Trapper ope the door and ushers him in. INT. UTILITY ROOM – DAY It's a small room containing, among other items, a table  with a pot of coffee and cups which are available to medi personnel at all hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all through work for the day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. Why do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you got time to sleep this  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his whole hundred and thirty pounds behind a righ uppercut that lands squarely on Frank's jaw. At the same  instant the door from the Operating Room opens, and Henry gallantly makes way for Hot Lips to precede him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank drops to the floor, momentarily knocked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T-Trapper!... C-C-Captain McIntyre...  what the hell... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Trapper  incredulously) That's a captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is coming to and could probably get back into the f by a count of eight if he had any desire to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trapper) What's going on? Who started this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean who hit who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. First and only blow. So far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) He wouldn't have touched me if I'd  had my guard up. Let us settle this  between ourselves, Colonel. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I'm running, an  English boarding school? McIntyre,  you're under arrest. Confine yourself  to quarters, pending an investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so, Henry. But remember  my claustrophobia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hot Lips) I deeply regret this unfortunate  incident. We try to remember we're a  military organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly would have thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. THE SWAMP – NIGHT Henry is standing indignantly over Trapper, who is sippin beer in his sleeping bag. Duke, Hawkeye and Ho-Jon are  witnesses to the encounter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I must have lost my  punch. I didn't think the son-of-a- bitch would get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop acting like a colonel, Henry.  You know Trapper wouldn't sock him  without a good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no reason good enough for  one medical officer to strike another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That there Frank Burns is a menace.  Whenever a patient croaks on him  it's either God's will or somebody  else's fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
