dialogues.text: This time he did it to a kid who's  simple enough to believe him. Why  don't you dump the mother, Henry? He  creates more work than he gets done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should fire him because he got in  the way of Trapper's fist? No. I've  put up with a lot from you guys, but  now I finally have to take  disciplinary action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. All of a sudden it's West  Point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... (to Trapper) I was going to name you Chief  Surgeon... (to Hawkeye) To consult on both shifts, yours and  Frank's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's great, Henry! Good  thinking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First decent idea you've had in a  month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'll have to wait at least a  week. If I announced it tomorrow,  after what our new Chief Nurse saw  this afternoon, they'd hear her  yelling from Seoul to Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MESS HALL – DAY Hot Lip's handsome face is relaxed into her most charming smile as she approaches Hawkeye at the table where he sit by himself having a late breakfast after a long night's w Hawkeye (like Trapper and Duke) no longer makes any attem at a proper military appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Pierce, would I be  imposing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, nobody as pretty as you could  ever impose... please sit down.  Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers her some from the pot beside him, and she holds out a cup while he pours it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I've been observing the  nurses on your shift. But naturally  your own opinion is more informed  than mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you feel that way, Major,  because you see it's a team effort...  doctors, nurses, enlisted men... and  I feel responsible for my whole team,  and I want you to know I'm satisfied  with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. We work well together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Burns is far from satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That don't surprise me. If you're a  good observer, you must have observed  by now that Frank Burns is a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary, I've observed he's  not only a good technical surgeon,  he's a good military surgeon. And  that includes how a man dresses and  how he bears himself and his sense  of what it means to be an officer in  the United States Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his track record, that don't  count? Look, honey, when you watch  the two shifts try to notice which  one does the most work with the least  fuss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've noticed that both nurses and  enlisted men address you as 'Hawkeye.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my name. Maybe that sounds silly  to you but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kind of familiarity is  inconsistent with maximum efficiency  in a military organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Major, honey. (pushes back his chair) I'm going to have a couple shots  scotch and go to bed. I'd normally  ask you to join me but obviously  you're a female version of the routine  Regular Army clown. And that turns  me off, so just leave my outfit alone  and we'll get along fine. (stands up to go) See you around the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icily) I wonder how a degenerated person  like you could have reached a position  of responsibility in the Army Medical  Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister, if I knew the answer to that  I sure as hell wouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. / INT. MESS HALL – DAY (SNOW ON GROUND) People are going in and out of the Mess Hall, when an  announcement comes over the public address system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over P.A. system) Attention, everybody. I have an  announcement. 'Effective today,  Thirteen April, Captain John S.  McIntyre, U.S. Army Reserve, is  appointed Chief Surgeon at 4077th  Mobile Army Surgical Hospital. Henry  B. Blake, Commanding Officer.' (informally, on his  own) Nice going, Trapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugly John and Captain Bandini shake Trapper's hand in  congratulations. The only two officers in the outfit who  don't like the news come out of the Mess Hall together: M Burns and Houlihan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no point appealing to Colonel  Blake. They've got him bewitched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The only thing to do is write  General Hammond. (knowing perfectly  well she has her own  tent) But it's hard to find a place around  here for a private discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a tent to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People will talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind. If we give them  something to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HOT LIP'S TENT – NIGHT Hot Lips finishes reading the letter she and Frank have  drafted, signs it and stands up as she folds it and puts in a prepared envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a marvelous letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a good team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's supper time. (as casually as he  can say it) But you're not hungry are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenous. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to hide his  disappointment) Well, sure, if you are, Margaret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, we want to get this letter  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her and kisses her and from her reaction we get clear picture of the kind of female she is. She responds the kiss fervently, pressing her lips and body against hi but the moment she decides to end it she switches right b to her businesslike manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sooner it reaches him, the sooner  we can turn this into a tight military  outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MASH MAIN BUILDING – AT MAIL DEPOSIT BOX – NIGHT Frank deposits the letter in the box while Hot Lips stand by. Then they proceed on their way to the Mess Hall, unaw that they have been observed by Radar on the other side o the partition into which the mailbox is set. INT. MASH MAIN BUILDING – NIGHT Radar picks up the letter Frank deposited and reads the  address. INT. THE SWAMP – NIGHT There is a party going on. Present, in addition to the th occupants, are Painless, Ugly John, Bandini, Judson, Voll Ho-Jon, Boone, Murrhardt and Seidman. Radar enters, engag Hawkeye's attention and shows him the letter. Hawkeye gla through it, looks to Radar for confirmation and, getting tears up the letter. Meanwhile under Duke's leadership, a bedpan is affixed with adhesive tape to Trapper's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hail to the chief! We-all got a  responsibility, men. He's crowned  like a king ought to be, but he can't  just walk to the Mess Hall by himself.  He has to be carried by native  bearers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking, Duke. How about it,  Ho-Jon? Can you round up a few of  the boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get what you mean, native  bearers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bear is the same thing as carry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the other word I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afraid of where this  is leading) Never mind. Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) A native is someone who is born in a  particular place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I go to New York, the natives  there will carry me? I don't think  so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I should have opened  my big mouth. Sorry, Ho-Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) That's okay. Live a little, learn a  little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MESS HALL – NIGHT Frank and Hot Lips, sitting by themselves in a corner are disgusted, and the rest of the people there are mildly am by the spectacle of Trapper's entrance. The new Chief Sur still wearing his bedpan crown, is borne in on his cot by Hawkeye, Duke, Painless and Ugly John. They set him down break into song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Hail to the Chief And King of all  the surgeons He needs a queen To  satisfy his urgin's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly, pointing at  Hot Lips) I'd like to try out that one over  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, Your Majesty. (starting toward Frank  and Hot Lips) Congratulations, Frank. He picked  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you want to play it straight? (to Hot Lips) I guess I owe you an apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes blazing with indignation, Hot Lips gets up and s out. Frank follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HOT LIPS' TENT – NIGHT Frank is sitting next to Hot Lips on her cot with a sooth arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godless buffoons, all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her hands on his  face, turning it  towards her) It's that disrespect for you, that's  what I can't forgive them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm used to it. What makes me  sore is how they behave towards you. (pulling her into a  tight embrace) They ought to be grateful to have  you. (kisses her, his hand  vanishing beneath  her skirt) I certainly am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (undoing one of his  buttons and sliding  her hand under his  blouse) And I'm grateful for you, Frank,  especially with those boors around.  We've grown very close in a short  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her around the neck and bosom, removing such of the clothing as gets in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't just chance, I'm sure of  that. God meant us to find each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of lingering on a scene that threatens to become  pornographic, our attention is drawn down beneath Hot Lip cot, where a strange object is being inserted under the c wall of the tent. It is a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His will be done. (then, in excited  response to an  inflammatory move on  his part) Da-a-arling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. HOT LIPS' TENT – NIGHT Radar, who has just planted the microphone, lets a coil o wire spin out as he moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HENRY'S OUTER OFFICE – NIGHT Gathered here illicitly, in what is not only Sergeant  Vollmer's domain but the communication hub of the post, a Trapper, Duke, Radar and Ugly John. They are listening, o their own private speaker, to what is being said in Hot L tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speaker) Frank... Frank... Frank... Frank...  Frank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd'y'all reckon he's doing to  her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casting her horoscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speaker) Give me your lips, love. Set me on  fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Radar) Plug it in, boy. We got no call to  be selfish with a show like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar accordingly transfers the lead from the microphone the outlet for the post loudspeaker system. EXT. ENLISTED MEN'S TENTS – NIGHT The occupants of one tent are engaged in a crap game, whi the men in the adjoining one are settling down for the ni They are all dumbfounded to hear Hot Lips' voice over the public address speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speaker) I want you to make love to me all  night. I don't want anything to take  you away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye is performing surgery on a patient, assisted by  Captain Bandini. Both doctors and Leslie, the nurse worki with them, have stopped to listen to the lovers' dialogue coming over the OR speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speaker) Nothing can, with the Colonel gone.  I'm in charge tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HOT LIPS' TENT – NIGHT Frank is on top of Hot Lips and, though the details of th amorous activity are hidden under the covers, we can see  enough to know it is reaching a climax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like a man who is in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each word she speaks is instantly echoed on the speaker s so that the word "charge" is still sounding after she has finished saying it. She suddenly realizes there is someth wrong, though she doesn't immediately figure out what it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbed) Frank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop now! Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word "please" is repeated so distinctly outside that, while Frank in his critical condition remains unaware of Hot Lips sits bolt upright, pushing him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FRONT OF THE 4077TH – DAY A Jeep driven by Henry pulls up near the hospital entranc from which Radar emerges to meet him. Leslie also joins t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Radar. How were things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splendid, sir. No problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MESS HALL – DAY Hot Lips is finishing breakfast at a table with some of t other nurses. Frank is sitting near her but at another ta with a handful of male officers, including Hawkeye direct opposite him. Duke and Trapper enter together as Hot Lips rises to leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerily, to nurses) Morning, girls. Good morning Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, Frank. Hiya, Hot Lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke and Trapper continue on their way to their table in officers' section. Frank reacts angrily and is about to g after Duke when Hot Lips touches his shoulder and speaks a low tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, leave all the rowdiness to them.  Calm down, drink your coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye probably can't make out her exact words, but his  gaze follows her as she goes out the open door. The he lo at Frank, bending low across the table as if he, too, had something confidential to say, but actually speaking quit distinctly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Frank, is that stuff you're  tapping any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank reacts with such rage he can't speak for a moment. EXT. MESS HALL – DAY Henry, Leslie and Radar, passing by the Mess Hall entranc encounter Hot Lips on her way out. Her salute catches Hen by surprise, but he makes a quick stab at returning it th his attention is on what he sees through the Mess Hall  windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Radar) Hawkeye and Frank Burns. That's  encouraging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MESS HALL – DAY Hawkeye, who can see Henry outside (which Frank can't),  affects surprise at receiving no answer to his question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just asking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up or I'll tear you apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MESS HALL – DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you make out what they're talking  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MESS HALL – DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only wanted to know what she's  like in the sack. Do those big boobs  hold up or are they kind of droopy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MESS HALL – DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Henry) Hawkeye's asking the Major's opinion  on a point of anatomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MESS HALL – DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also I'm curious whether she's a  moaner or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say that again and I'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MESS HALL – DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Major wishes to have the question  repeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MESS HALL – DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, does she go in for sound  effects...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps a wary eye on Frank while talking, and thus is a to duck the coffee pot Frank hurls at him. From where Hen stands in the doorway, this act of unprovoked aggression astonishing enough, for he can see Hawkeye innocently eat his cereal, but the Colonel is even more amazed when Fran follows it by springing across the table onto Hawkeye and raining blows on him. Hawkeye puts up no resistance but s covers his head and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! He's gone mad! Help, somebody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MASH COMPOUND – DAY Two MPs are dragging Frank in a straitjacket to an MP Jee They load him into the back and one of them gets in along him while the other takes the wheel. Watching the MPs drive off with their prisoner are Henry, Duke and Trapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair's fair, Henry. If I get into  Hot Lips and jump Hawkeye Pierce, do  I get to go home, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. REPUBLIC OF KOREA ARMY INDUCTION CENTER IN SEOUL – D (SNOW IS GONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now February. A jeep with Hawkeye at the wheel, Ho- beside him, drives up to the entrance. Hawkeye gives Ho-J a final instruction as the boy gets out of the Jeep and g into the building. Hawkeye finds a place to park in the s Lieutenant Scorch is with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really nice of you to take me  along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have much choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really say the cutest things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KOREAN ARMY INDUCTION CENTER – DAY The locale is established by the presence of military  personnel in uniform and the fact that a KOREAN ARMY DOCT with the aid of one assistant, is examining in quick  succession a long line of naked young Korean boys. Ho-Jon turn comes up and we see how perfunctory the process is: brief overall scrutiny for visible defects, a blood press reading, and the application of a stethoscope to a few ke spots. Ho-Jon looks healthy and the doctor is startled by the unexpected reaction he gets on applying the stethosco to the boy's heart. He turns to check the blood pressure  figure which his assistant is about to record on the form has taken from Ho-Jon. Apparently the pressure is just as out-of-line as the  heartbeat, and the doctor feels Ho-Jon is ineligible for  military service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to assistant, in  Korean) We can't take this one. His heartbeat  is much too fast, and his blood  pressure is dangerously high. (to Ho-Jon) Have you ever seen a doctor before? (abruptly, to assistant) Wait a minute! What does it say there  about where he's been working? (takes Ho-Jon's form  and reads the  information for  himself; then, to  assistant) Get the check on his urine sample  right away. (to Ho-Jon) You'll have to wait around for a  while, young man. I need some more  information before I talk to you  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. KOREAN ARMY INDUCTION CENTER – DAY Hawkeye, with Lieutenant Scorch, waiting in the Jeep, is  startled at being addressed by a stranger, whom he recogn as the doctor that examined Ho-Jon. Ho-Jon is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English) You please excuse... (as Hawkeye turns and  sees them) I have been making examination of  this young man to find if he will be  soldier in our army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. Hi, Ho-Jon. How did it  go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't liking it at all, what I  hear when I listen to the heart. And  such a blood pressure for so young a  boys. Is frightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that. You think  he's unfit for military service?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first is no doubt. But then I am  seeing on his paper he work in  American hospital. And I think there  are so many drugs in such a places,  he could take some by mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is knowing? But the drug I have  find in his urine is solving all  mysteries. By tomorrow will be gone  his fast heart and high blood  pressure. So I think maybe you will  like to tell him goodbye. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives Hawkeye a warm smile and leaves the two of them  alone. It's clear from Hawkeye's expression that he has n choice but to admit defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Ho-Jon. I didn't think they'd  be that sharp. But I'm still going  to start the ball rolling for you to  go to college in America when you  get out. My old school, Androscoggin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. OFFICERS' LATRINE – DAY It's a warm spring day in a climate much like the northea part of the United States. At first we see nothing but th latrine tent, which is identified by a sign. A couple of  small missiles propelled with considerable force strike t canvas, but it is only when they roll back to the ground  that we can identify them as golf balls. A closer look at the ground area reveals a dozen other balls scattered aro and then we see two Korean Houseboys appear from protecte places on the sides of the tent, looking carefully to mak sure there are no more balls coming, and proceed to gathe up those on the ground. During this action there is the S of a helicopter landing near the hospital. EXT. FIELD BEHIND OFFICERS' LATRINE – DAY The disreputability in clothes and grooming that has been increasing with each view of the Swampmen has reached an  extreme stage in the view we now get of Hawkeye and Trapp ALong with their soiled fatigue pants, Hawkeye wears a to dirty T-shirt of some unlikely color, Trapper a sport shi that looks as if he had picked it up in Hawaii on the way over and worn it ever since. Both are unshaven. Each has a well-equipped golf bag into which he now repla the iron club he has been using for the medium-range shot they have been practicing. Taking out drivers, they set t in the ground and, as the houseboys run up with the balls Trapper indicates they will be shooting down the longest  dimension of the field. After addressing the balls with a few practice swings, they deliver expert drives that are only in the 250-yard range but fairly straight in the int direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with himself) I came within about ten yards of  you. You know something, Trapper,  the way we been going, if we ever  got to see a real golf course again,  I bet we could burn it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as the greens maybe. I don't  know if my putting would come back  or not, without some practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the helicopter taking off again doesn't conc them till they realize it is headed directly toward them. comes down so close to them they step back to avoid the w from the propeller blades, which the PILOT keeps going as and Vollmer climb out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to pilot) That's him on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Captain McIntyre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trapper) The Lieutenant's flown up from Seoul  just to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Captain McIntyre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the Army calls me. Stick  out your tongue, take off your shirt  and tell me where it hurts you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face showing his bewilderment, the Pilot silently han Trapper a long white envelope and a large brown one. Trap tears open the white one, glances at the top copy of the  order it contains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '...Proceed immediately to Kokura,  Japan...' (to Pilot) Do you know what this is about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a GI there whose father's a  Congressman. A grenade went off in  training and they think there's a  piece of it in his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening brown envelope) These his X-rays?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Apparently some big chest  surgeon in Boston told the Congressman  the only man to take care of his son  was Captain John McIntyre. (his doubt undiminished) I suppose there could be more than  one doctor with that name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapper meanwhile has held the X-rays up to the sunlight invited Hawkeye to look at them at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back at  orders; to Hawkeye) General Hammond says I can take anyone  along I need to assist me. Want to  come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye uses the pretense of scanning the X-rays from ano angle to draw Trapper aside, so they can speak without th Pilot and Vollmer hearing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure the goddam thing's  in his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course it isn't, but how many chances  do we get to go to Japan? With our  golf clubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. AIRPORT IN KOKURA, JAPAN – DAY It is a bright, sunny afternoon in peaceful Japan. Hawkey and Trapper, in the same outlandish clothes, walk from th military transport plane in which they have made the trip from Seoul, and approach a car with "25TH STATION HOSPITA emblazoned on its side. The driver, SERGEANT GORMAN, is asleep. With their golf c slung over their shoulders, they get into the back seat.  Hawkeye pulls the door closed with the loudest possible B and succeeds in waking Gorman, who turns on them with out indignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrada there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me translate. I've had some  exposure to the language. The young  man is from Brooklyn and he wants us  to vacate this vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gorman) But weren't you supposed to meet the  surgeons who are going to slice up  the Congressman's son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are the quacks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betcher ever-loving A, buddy- boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor kid. Goddam Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But besides the operation, we've got  to get in at least eighteen holes of  golf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's haul ass, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddam Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ARMY CAR – DAY There is silence between Sergeant Gorman and his passenge as the military hospital comes into view. But something e comes into view in the distance at the same time: the  unmistakable contours of a golf course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful. What do you think? Should  we stop and play nine holes now and  operate on the kid later? If he's  still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddam Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we ought to operate first,  no frills, get through it on the  double. Then we'll be nice and relaxed  on the course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddam, goddam Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are coming to a stop in front of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY A PRETTY WAC sits behind a reception desk doing a job so  utterly routine she doesn't even look up from her magazin when Hawkeye puts a question to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Congressman's son at,  honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ward Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then she does glimpse enough of their costumes to tak full look, and her reaction indicates clearly that she is not prepared for unkempt, unmilitary-looking men carrying golf bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you can't go in there! Who are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the pro from Dover and this is  my favorite caddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can't go in. No till you  tell me your business and I check  with Colonel Merrill's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relenting) Well, if you must know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Trapper has meanwhile made a feint toward the door, t which the Pretty Wac responds by rising and interposing  herself in his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye) Hold it. If this soldier enforces  her own orders. I'm ready to take  her on. Anxious. Single combat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward the girl, who holds her ground staunchly  till they are almost in contact. Then she takes a step ba and continues to take one step backwards for each one of in her direction. When they get close to the door, her  resistance collapses entirely and she scurries back to he seat at the desk, where she grabs the phone as Trapper an Hawkeye march through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Colonel Marril's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY All personnel, American and Japanese (who, like the Korea at MASH, do the menial work) react in surprise to the sig of Trapper and Hawkeye making their way around a few corn till they find Ward Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. WARD SIX – DAY Two golf bags are propped against the foot of the  Congressman's son's bed. Trapper listens closely to the b chest while Hawkeye bends down to his ear to reassure him WARD NURSE hovers near him, not actually cooperating with them but not defying them either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Congressman's son) Don't worry, son. That's Captain  McIntyre, and he's the best chest  surgeon in the Far East and maybe in  the whole U.S. Army. He'll fix you  up fine. Your daddy saw to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like we thought, it's a routine  problem. Nurse, who's in charge of  operating room preparations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time he has begun his question to her, the WARD NU has spotted someone approaching of whom she is in obvious dread. And it is at this figure that she points by way of answer: a firece looking NURSE CORPS CAPTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh-sh-she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anticipating that a major confrontation is about to take  place, Trapper and Hawkeye decide to keep it away from th patient's beside. Accordingly they pick up their golf bag and go to meet the advancing Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you hoodlums doing in this  hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely) We're surgeons, ma'am, we're here to  work. All we want is our starting  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even look at a patient  here till Colonel Merrill says it's  okay. And he's still out for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Look, Mother. I want to go to work  in one hour. We're the pros from  Dover and we figure to crack that  kid's chest and get out to the golf  course before it's dark. So find the  gas-passer and tell him to premedicate  the patient. Then bring me the latest  pictures on him; the ones we saw  must be forty-eight hours old by  now. And tell the kitchen to rustle  up some lunch. Ham and eggs'll do;  steak would be even better. And give  me at least one nurse who knows how  to work in close without getting her  tits in my way. (as she hesitates) You're going to have to move quicker  than that. I said an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL OPERATING ROOM – DAY CAPTAIN E.B. (ME LAY) MARSTON is the anesthesiologist at 25th. Wearing gown, cap, and mask, he is busily at work checkin the Congressman's son to make sure he is properly  anesthetized. At that moment the doors open and in come  Trapper and Hawkeye, also wearing OR outfits, as are the nurses who stand by waiting for them. Trapper looks  questioningly at Me Lay, who answers with a nod that all ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL OPERATING ROOM – DAY The atmosphere in the OR is tense. Hawkeye is maintaining proper traction on the clamp that holds the lung in place while Trapper concentrates on removing the fragment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I demand an explanation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLONEL MERRILL, Commanding Officer of the hospital, has  stormed through the OR swinging doors in full military un without any antiseptic precautions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to circulating nurse) Get that dirty old man out of the  operating room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Colonel Merrill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat it, Pop. If this chest gets  infected, I'll tell the Congressman  who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To everyone's astonishment, including the Colonel's, it w He turns around and walks out without another word. Most  affected of all by Hawkeye's audacity is Me Lay, who reac with a sharp look in Hawkeye's direction and then by pick up his anesthesia chart and writing, in the space labeled "First Assistant," the name "Hawkeye Pierce."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm closing up. Everybody relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye) May I have the surgeon's name, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the pro from Dover and I'm the  Ghost of Smokey Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save that crap for the rest of the  clamdiggers back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both surgeons stop working in their surprise. Hawkeye loo at the anesthesia chart and sees where Me Lay has written his name. Then he takes a closer look at Me Lay himself, what shows of him between his cap and his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trapper) Did I ever tell you about Me Lay  Marston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your high school friend who went  around saying 'Me lay, you lay?' to  all the young females in the  community. As I remember, you said  it was quite a successful approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he wouldn't score more than  once in seven or eight tries, but  the important thing was he didn't  waste time socializing. Anyway,  Trapper John, this is Me Lay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real Trapper John? The one who  threw you the famous pass and went  to greater glory on the Boston and  Maine Railroad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one and only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proud to know you, Trapper. Like to  shake your hand if you'll hurry up  and get that chest closed. (looks around to make  sure the nurses can't  hear) You still working the trains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planes mostly. May take a crack at  rickshaws. How does the direct  approach work over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been out of action since I got  over here five months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't go after the local scrunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too busy, actually. Not for the  Army, of course, but where I live.  Dr. Yamachi's New Era Pediatric  Hospital and Whorehouse. I'm serious.  The guy has this crude hospital for  kids and a whorehouse on the side to  finance it, all in the same building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SURGEONS' DRESSING ROOM, 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY Hawkeye and Trapper have washed and put their golf practi clothes back on. Me Lay is dressed in fresh fatigues with Captain's bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Me Lay) What do you do in the joint besides  pimp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's about the only thing I don't  do – that I'm built for. I inspect  the girls and take care of some of  the kids in the hospital. Sometimes  I tend bar and act as bouncer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CORPORAL enters with the manner of a messenger from on  high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Pierce? Captain McIntyre?  Colonel Merrill wishes you to report  to his office immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him we'll think about it. (to Trapper) I suppose we do have to reach some  sort of understanding with the old  boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Me Lay) What's the bastard really like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for the Corporal's  benefit as well as  theirs) Colonel Merrill is a veteran of twenty- five years in the Regular Army, a  soldier first and a doctor second. A  member of several patriotic  organizations, he believes it's  America's God-given mission to  maintain a foothold for freedom on  the Asian mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bad? (to Hawkeye) But I guess you're right. We might  as well see him. (reaches for golf  bag, to Corporal) Got any caddie carts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapper just slings his golf bag over his shoulder with a sigh, as does Hawkeye. Me Lay, meanwhile, has written a f words on a scrap of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Corporal) Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands paper to Hawkeye) The address of the N.E.P.H. and W.  Why don't you meet me there when  you're through golf for drinks and  dinner and whatever strikes the fancy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine's already been struck, and it  doesn't have to be very fancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Corporal) Lead the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corporal does so and they follow him out. INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY Hawkeye and Trapper come out of the dressing room after t Corporal and follow him down a corridor. Then they realiz to their surprise that there are two other soldiers follo them who have been stationed outside the dressing door. T invitation from the Colonel is getting to seem less casua every moment. INT. COLONEL MERRILL'S OUTER OFFICE – DAY A SECOND LIEUTENANT and a Sergeant seated on opposite sid of a desk look up with interest as Trapper and Hawkeye co in with escorts fore and aft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These the prisoners?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye and Trapper exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can wait in the Colonel's office.  He'll be back in a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Corporal opens the door to the Colonel's empty and qu luxurious office. Trapper and Hawkeye go in with their go bags. INT. COLONEL MERRILL'S OFFICE – DAY Trapper and Hawkeye enter, the door closing behind them, look around. It is a long time since they have seen  surroundings like these, with Western upholstered furnitu pictures on the walls and high quality wall-to-wall carpe It is this last feature that attracts Hawkeye's attention He squats down to feel its texture and with a look invite Trapper to do the same. Trapper is also impressed with th smoothness of the surface, and without having to exchange word about it, they each find a putter and a golf ball an start lining up targets for their brief sorely missed put practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. COLONEL MERRILL'S OFFICE – DAY The Colonel comes in militarily, which is the way he make all his entrances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You men are under arrest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! Can't you see I'm putting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have you...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! (completes a putt,  walks over and picks  up ball) Face it, Colonel, you don't have us,  we have you. Your boys blew this  case, we bailed you out. We figure  we ought to hang around a day to  check the Congressman's kid, and we  also figure to play some golf. So if  that's okay with you, we got a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if it isn't, why don't we call  Washington on your telephone? You  tell your story, we'll tell ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up his clubs) When you make up your mind, get in  touch. The golf club is probably the  best place to leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapper has also taken his golf bag, and the two of them  walk out serenely together. The Colonel supports himself his desk as he makes his way to his chair and sits down t absorb the shock to his system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JAPANESE GOLF CLUB PRO SHOP – LATE AFTERNOON The shop features an assortment of Western style golfing  attire, all about two decades behind the times. Trapper i holding a pair of 'plus fours' in front of him to test th size. The GOLF PRO looks on with the studied approval of dedicated salesman everywhere; Hawkeye with amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These the longest you've got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful. They are looking like  they are made for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye has discovered a pair of knee-length argyle socks which he exhibits to Trapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to have these to wear with  them. (glances out window) You know, by the time we get all  this stuff on, it'll be practically  dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two GIRL CADDIES enter the shop while he is speaking. The are very young, not more than seventeen, dressed in slack They see Trapper and Hawkeye's golf bags and start to sli them over their shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing) Yeah, maybe we ought to... (sees caddies) Hey, who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your caddies. But perhaps it is  becoming too late to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking over to  caddies for closer  look) Not at all. (touches the prettier  one under the chin  to raise her downcast  head) What's your name, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Trapper. We got to forget  golf for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why. As long as it's  light enough to see your caddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Golf Pro) What's the age of consent in this  country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which? I do not know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. (to Trapper) Let's take one sport at a time. The  place for tonight's is the New Era  Pediatric Hospital Et Cetera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DR. YAMACHI'S N.E.P.H. & W. – DINING ROOM – NIGHT Trapper and Hawkeye, dressed in kimonos, are sitting Japa style on the floor with Me Lay around a low table. Three  girls serve them attentively, doing everything for them e actually feeding them. A girl named MICHIKO takes away a plate that Trapper has  left virtually untouched and puts a bowl of thick soup in front of him. The second girl serves soup to Hawkeye and Me Lay, and th third brings in a large bowl of rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soup? Rice? What are we doing,  beginning all over again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we had a clear soup to start.  This is a thick one and you ought to  taste it. There's nothing like it  back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I taste it now? We've already  had like twelve courses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not wishing to eat more? I  bring you most special plum brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it. I don't want to  eat, I don't want to drink. (reaches out and grabs  Michiko's ankle) All I want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK on the door, followed immediately by the entrance of a Japanese nurse, who indicates an urgent des to speak to Me Lay. Me Lay gets up and listens to what sh tells him in an undertone. Trapper meanwhile has succeede in pulling Michiko off her feet, and makes clear the gene direction of his intentions by sprawling out on the floor with her in his embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye and Trapper) Can you guys take one minute to look  at a kid for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Me Lay) Why can't you look at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have but well, you know, I've been  mainly an anesthetist a long time  now and... well, I'd like you guys  to take a look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, one of the girls got careless  and two days ago she gave birth to  an eight-pound American-Japanese  male.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every time we feed him, it either  comes right back up or he coughs and  turns blue and has a hell of a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (releasing Michiko  and sitting up  reluctantly) We don't have to see him. Call that  halfassed Army hospital and tell  them to be ready to put some lipiodol  in this kid's esophagus and take X- rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's ten-thirty at night. We  can't get military personnel out for  a civilian. A foreign civilian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give them any unnecessary  details. Just say the pros from Dover  are on their way with an emergency.  And you'd better get the OR cranked  up because I got a feeling you're  going to pass some gas while I help  Trapper close a little bastard's  tracheo-esophageal fistula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Three OR nurses are at work getting things on order when swinging doors open and Me Lay, carrying the two-day-old  baby, enters, accompanied by Hawkeye and Trapper. Nothing has led the nurses to expect an infant patient, and they distinctly taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did that baby come from? Is  that what you got us up for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ladies, that's why we got you  up. Me Lay, put him down there... (indicating operating  table) ...and get ready to start giving him  the anesthetic. (to nurses) We stumbled on this deal. We didn't  want it but we don't see how we can  walk away from it, no matter whose  rules are broken. This baby has no  legal right to be taken care of in  an Army hospital, though his father  was probably an American soldier.  But he's going to die if we don't  fix him now, tonight. So what about  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me Lay places the mask attached to his gas container on t baby's face ans starts to administer a carefully limited  quantity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time I will not be intimidated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has come into the OR while he is talking, and he is so menacing that all preparations are halted while he finish his pronouncement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I command that this improper and  illegal use of Army facilities cease  immediately. Twice you men have forced  me into appeasing your aggression by  threatening me with what you'll say  to a certain Congressman. Well, I  don't care what you tell him or anyone  else! I don't care if it costs me my  command and my whole career in the  Army. On this point I stand as a  matter of principle, as unshakable  as the Rock of Gibraltar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me Lay? Trapper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving in concert, Hawkeye and Trapper grab Colonel Merri and drag him over to Me Lay's end of the operating table. Lay takes the anesthetic mask from the baby's face and cl it firmly on the Colonel's. The Colonel struggles for a w but they manage to hold him and pretty soon he is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the Rock of Gibraltar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DR. YAMACHI'S N.E.P.H. & W. – HALLWAY – NIGHT Trapper, Hawkeye and Me Lay are half-dragging, half-carry Colonel Merrill along a corridor, and girls, including Mi and the others we have seen before, have come out of thei rooms to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get his clothes off quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DR. N.E.P.H. & W. – BEDROOM – NIGHT Colonel Merrill is stirring on the bed as Hawkeye and Me remove the last item of his clothing. The Colonel opens h eyes but he is still too drugged to have any idea where h is or how he got there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Michiko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michiko moves toward the bed, removing the kimono which i her only garment. At the same time Hawkeye grabs a camera which is all ready for use with a flashbulb attachment an starts to take a series of shots of the Colonel and Michi both naked in the bed. The Colonel reacts to the intermit bursts of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, you no worry, sweetheart.  Just keeping close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after five or six  shots) All right, that's plenty. You can  put your clothes on, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michiko reaches for her kimono and puts it back on as she gets out of bed. The Colonel sits up, still a bit dazed b becoming more aware of what's happening all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been framed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they all say. But I have  photographic evidence here that you're  a lecherous old man and a disgrace  to the uniform. However, I won't  even develop the film if your people  watch that baby we operated on like  he was the Congressman's grandson.  Which for all we know he may be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DR. YAMACHI'S N.E.P.H. & W. – HALLWAY – NIGHT Michiko joins Me Lay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Captain McIntyre? I am  waiting so long for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me Lay open a bedroom door, revealing Trapper fully dress and sound asleep on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him a few hours, Michiko. Right  now he couldn't get up a flight of  stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michiko's answering smile indicates superior feminine wis in these matters. She goes into the room, closing the doo behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. WARD SIX. 25TH STATION HOSPITAL – DAY Hawkeye, dressed in the Japanese adaptation of the well- dressed American golfer of the 1930's, and carrying his g bag, is at the Congressman's son's bedside. He looks at t boy's chart and then at the patient himself, finding both them quite satisfactory. INT. HOSPITAL ROOM – DAY Trapper, similarly outfitted with individual variations o his own, has just examined the baby they operated on. He  writes out some instructions and gives them to a nurse. T he picks up his golf bag and goes out to a corridor where Hawkeye is waiting for him. They start to walk toward the hospital entrance, finally  ready for a few hours of relaxation on the golf course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker  system) Captain Pierce and Captain McIntyre!  Please contact the message center.  Captain Pierce and Captain McIntyre!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other with foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It couldn't be good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By joint unspoken agreement, they quicken their pace in t same direction. Then their resolution falters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a passing nurse) Where's the goddam message center?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. 4077TH MASH – LATE AFTERNOON OR facilities are being utilized to capacity. For the fir time we see Henry himself in surgeon's working dress, win up an operation. Completing his work, looking tired and  anxious, he walks through the crowded OR to the Preop War which is also jammed up with cases awaiting surgery. Lesl comes to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the lineup, Major?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six cases ready for surgery, sir,  and four more that just need a little  more blood or a little more time for  the antibiotics to take hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we can handle them, if there  aren't any six o'clock choppers.  Every time they fly while it's still  daylight, they've got wounded that  can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – LATE AFTERNOON Henry's watch says a minute or two after six o'clock. Onc more, as at the beginning, he is standing outside the  Admitting Ward with Radar, listening for helicopters comi from the north. Radar, straining his superhearing to list reacts unhappily to a sound neither we nor Henry can catc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chopper coming in, Colonel. Two of  them, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a puzzled look) And another one, but it's from the  south. (looking south) There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks eagerly to the south as the COMBINED SOUND of three helicopters becomes audible and quickly mounts in  intensity. EXT. SKY TO THE SOUTH – DAY A helicopter (the type that came from Seoul to pick up Tr and Hawkeye, rather than the Air Rescue Squadron ones tha bring the wounded from the front) approaches the landing  area and starts to make its descent. There is a golf bag  full of clubs attached to each of its pods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ADMITTING WARD – DAY Trapper and Hawkeye, conspicuous because they are still i their golf costumes, are among the surgeons checking the  newly arrived wounded. More cases are still being brought from helicopters and ambulances, mainly on stretchers, a under their own power assisted by a Medical Corpsman or t This is really the most hideous face of war; the mangled  bodies and limbs and faces, the expressions alive with pa and dulled by shock, are more terrible than any number of quiescent corpses. Trapper finishes examining a man and s to Hot Lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one goes right to the OR. Tell  Duke to do him ahead of the busted  spleen. (moving on to another  patient, a Korean) And this kid can't wait. I'll take  him myself, before I get to that  ruptured diaphragm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... (securing his attention) 'This kid' is a prisoner of war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an American boy's rupture you're  supposed to close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, we get a deluge like this,  just deciding priorities on a medical  basis is hard enough. So never mind  the side issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT A few days later. Duke is working deep inside a belly wit new young surgeon, CAPTAIN LAPHAM, assisting him. Lapham  glances at the patient's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke looks, too, and the patient's eyes are enough to tel him the job he's doing no longer has any function. After almost superfluous check of the heartbeat, Lapham closes man's eyes. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye, with Ugly John handling the anesthetic, is diggi out pieces of metal from a face that will never quite loo like a face again. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Trapper, with Painless filling in as anesthesioloigist, i working in close to a patient's heart. Suddenly all the l in the OR go out. This is not an unprecedented event, and one by one three corpsmen appear in different locations a the operating table with flashlights whose combined beams make it possible for Trapper to carry on. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT With the electric light restored, Duke and Lapham are at  work on another case, removing several feet of small bowe no longer useful to the owner. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Henry and Murrhardt, with Scorch assisting, are amputatin an arm. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT A dead patient, face covered with a sheet is removed from operating table by two corpsmen. Immediately two other  corpsmen bring a stretcher to the other side of the table and unload a new patient onto it. Ugly John and a nurse s to prepare him for surgery. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye, with Knocko helping, is sewing up an incision wh we can see is in the area of the groin. Dago Red comes by

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice looking kid. Going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll live if that's what you mean.  But somebody better be around when  he comes to and finds out there's  nothing left between his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ADMITTING WARD – DAY A few days later. A new group of patients is being brough in on stretchers by corpsmen. Trapper and Duke are examin an unconscious Negro private. Trapper looks at him with  special attention to the eyes. The right pupil is dilated and fixed. Duke meanwhile checks his pulse and blood pres

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse, slow, very little pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that right eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epidural hematoma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what else. You've been  that route a little, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough to be a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to another case. Duke continues to examine the  private with particular attention to the right side of th head. The more he observes, the more alarmed he becomes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to corpsman) Into the OR! Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs ahead of the stretcher through the Preop Ward. At the entrance to the OR he runs into Knocko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, Knocko, get me gloves, knife,  hammer, chisel, Gelfoam and a drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY Knocko finishes saving and cleaning the right temporal ar of the unconscious private's head, and Duke wastes no tim making an incision down to the bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, give me the hammer and chisel.  There are drills you can make nice,  neat holes in the skull with, but we  ain't got none. (taking hammer and  chisel, fortifying  himself for the act) So here goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pounds the chisel into the private's skull and keeps a it till he cracks his way through. Blood flows out in a  torrent. Duke pulls his tools away and just watches. Very quickly he is rewarded by the sight of a torrent diminish to a dribble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sew him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stuffs Gelfoam down into the bleeding site, puts in a  rubber drain and starts to sew the skin back together wit silk sutures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY The private is moaning and stirring restlessly on the tab as Duke finishes closing the incision and Knocko takes th Patient's pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulse is way back. Nearly sixty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took the pressure off his brain.  You know, Knocko, this boy might  just make it, and if he does you and  me ought to be ready with a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing everybody knows for sure  that don't know hardly anything else,  is how delicate any kind of brain  surgery is. So I certainly wouldn't  like it if there was somebody going  around saying all I did was crack  him on the head with a hammer and  chisel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ADMITTING WARD – DAY Hawkeye is examining a young PRIVATE FIRST CLASS who is i shock, semiconscious and saturated with mud over his whol uniform, hair and skin. There is a muddy, bloody bandage  around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a corpsman) Get that bandage off so I can see  what the hell's underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves on to the next stretcher. The corpsman undoes th bandage and pulls it away. The Private First Class turns head to the left, and blood spurts two feet into the air  from a hole in the right side of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, Mama! Oh, Mama, I'm dying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood continues to gush as the people in the immediat vicinity watch in fascination. As it comes down again if  falls on the PFC's face and into his mouth. He reacts by  coughing, spraying his audience with blood. Hawkeye runs  back and sticks his index finger down the hole, blocking the severed artery and stopping the flow of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to corpsmen) Bring him to the OR right on this  stretcher. I can't take my finger  out. Somebody find Ugly John and get  his ass in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are already in motion toward OR, Hawkeye moving alon beside the stretcher with his finger in the hole. On the they pass near Leslie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is urgent, Les. Start  somebody cutting off his clothes.  Tell the lab to come in with a couple  of pints of low titre O, and type  and cross-match him for five or six  more. Get somebody to do two  countdowns and start the blood. Come  to think of it, get somebody to start  rounding up donors, and send some  cowboys to Seoul for all the goddam  blood they can get. And get that  miserable gas-passer in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at OR entrance) I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Get him asleep and a tube in  him if you can. His common carotid  is cut and I can't do anything with  the son-of-a-bitch jumping all over  the place. (to Leslie) Find somebody to help me. I got to  keep a finger on this or we lose  him, and I can't get it clamped with  my left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – DAY The PFC has been transferred to an operating table withou Hawkeye losing his finger pressure on the artery. The clo have been cut off him, and Ugly John has both blood and  anesthetic going into him, the latter through an intratra tube. Hawkeye has a scalpel in his left hand and with it enlarges the wound around his right index finger. Then he tries to slide a Kelly clamp down his finger into the wou to clamp the artery but he can't manage it lefthanded. He looks desperately around the OR only to observe that e surgeon and nurse is fully engaged, including Henry and H Lips. Ugly John is having a hard time fulfilling his dual function as it is, and can't possibly take on another. Ha tried again with the clamp and fails, and then, to his gr relief, there appears within in his peripheral vision as concentrates his attention on the PFC's neck, a male figu gowned, capped, masked and gloved. It doesn't matter to  Hawkeye which of his colleagues it is; he just tells him  what assistance he needs from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab this Kelly, ride it down my  fingers and we'll have this mother  under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newcomer, though Hawkeye doesn't realize it, is Dago  Red. Following instructions, he takes the clamp and inserts it the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do with it Hawk? This is a  little out of my line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't recognize you, Red. When you  get the clamp all the way down, open  it as wide as you can and see if you  can close it on the artery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dagor Red obeys these orders cautiously. When he widens t clamp and starts to close it again, he has the satisfying sensation of feeling something substantial, and seizes it vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what he has grabbed with the clamp is Hawkeye's finge and Hawkeye, by reflex action, pulls it out to where we c see it with the clamp grasping it. The blood starts to sp again and Hawkeye goes back into the wound, but this time with his left index finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got my finger for Christ's sake.  But maybe I can do better with my  right hand. (inserts a retractor  into wound, puts the  working end of it in  Dago Red's hands,  taking back the Kelly  clamp) Pull it toward you. More. Good. (rides clamp down his  left index finger  and this time he  closes it on the  right place) There. That does it for now. (to Ugly John) We'll keep him right where he is  till Trapper John can give me a hand  sewing that artery back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – LATE AFTERNOON Two helicopters descend to the ground, and corpsmen start unloading the wounded. Also visible are a couple of ambul that are being unloaded. Henry and the three Swampmen hav stepped outside the Admitting Ward entrance to watch. The are all haggard, unshaven and groggy, but Henry, the olde is the one who shows the strain the most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteenth straight day there've been  six o'clock choppers. How long can a  battle go on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to relax, Henry. Since the  deluge started, you been working in  the OR and running the outfit, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best thing you could do for all of  us is grab some sack time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Radar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar appears as usual on the instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir? I've been trying to persuade  the Colonel to take some rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, stop persuading, just make  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Duke) Yes, sir. (to Henry) Come along, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is so fatigued he allows himself to be led away by  Radar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, Henry, outside of us, no  one'll even know you're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. PREOP WARD – DAY Here the more seriously wounded of those brought into the Admitting Ward are getting transfusions, have had Foley  catheters inserted in their bladders and/or Levin tubes i their stomachs, and have their X-rays on display on wires front of each cot. Trapper, Hawkeye and Duke are checking them to establish priorities. They reach the last cot, on which Ho-Jon is lying, attended by a Corpsman we haven't  seen before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid is pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of habit Hawkeye looks at the X-ray first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, Trapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at X-ray) Okay, but I'll need you to help.  Duke, will you take that belly back  there? The Australian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke turns back to undertake his assignment. Trapper and  Hawkeye continue to study the X-ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in pretty deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and he's lost a lot of blood.  I'm afraid it's hit more that just  the lung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon opens his eyes and smiles at the sight of his old  friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ho-Jon) You'll be okay, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I got the best there is.  Captain Pierce and Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, it's Ho-Jon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, Ho-Jon. You got a piece of a  shell in your chest, but we'll take  it out as soon as you've had more  blood. Hey, Radar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar, passing through the ward, comes over in response t the summons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Radar) Has that A-negative come from Seoul?  We'll need some in the OR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't any. We keep ordering  and they don't deliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to have at least one pint.  It's for Ho-Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar reacts in surprise and looks toward Ho-Jon's cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye is assisting Trapper in making the incision in Ho Jon's right chest. Ugly John is giving the boy additional anesthetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we squeeze him through, I'm going  to get him into Androscoggin College.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about squeezing him through into  Dartmouth? If all he wants to do is  catch lobsters, he can learn that  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dartmouth's too big and too expensive.  If he's as good as I think he is, he  can move into the big league later.  But Androscoggin first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying the incision) We'll need room. The sixth rib goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind the conversation. Do it,  Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aspirate the blood from the chest  cavity. Damn, there's more of it  than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preparing to use  suction device) If we don't get that pint, he's in  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. AND INT. HENRY'S TENT – NIGHT Radar, followed by an associate lab technician, enters He tent. Henry is snoring away in deep sleep. Gently Radar straigh Henry's right arm and deftly injects Novocaine over a vei Henry stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling in sleep) Not now, honey. Gobacksleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lab technician tightens the sleeve of Henry's T-shirt serve as a tourniquet, and Radar expertly inserts a needl into the vein and starts extracting blood into a pint  container. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye has finished aspirating the blood. Trapper reache down into the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphantly) I got it. Here, feel. In the cava.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his hand out and lets Hawkeye put his in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates that he wants to feel again. Hawkeye withdra his hand and Trapper puts his back in again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't feel it now either. The mother  must have gone in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in the cava and the hole sealed  itself off. I must have jiggled it  just enough to turn it loose. I can't  feel it in the heart or the right  pulmonary artery. So it's in the  left pulmonary artery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to close this hole and  make one on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be kind of rough on him if there's  no blood. Why don't we close up and  sit on him a couple of days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, that's the right way... at  John Hopkins or someplace. But how  do we know there won't be even more  of a jam-up a few days from now?  Maybe we won't be able to get to him  when we want to. Maybe the goddam  thing'll erode the artery when  nobody's looking. Our best shot is  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar comes up to the operating table with a container of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-negative. I've cross-matched it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I though you said we didn't have a  drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found a doner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Trapper has exposed Ho-Jon's left pulmonary artery. Duke Hawkeye are assisting him by applying traction to the tap on either side of where Trapper is now cutting the artery so that there is only a small flow of blood from the inci Trapper brings out his hand and displays the tiny metal  fragment which is the object of their efforts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ugly John) How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to nurse) Arterial silk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to sew the artery back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The artery is joined again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye and Duke) Ease off on those tapes, and let's  see how much it bleeds. (sees a few drops of  blood come through  incision) How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, we're home free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will he be able to write?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he got to write, for God's  sake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An application to Androscoggin  College.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HENRY'S OFFICE – DAY Henry is on the phone. Hawkeye, Duke, Painless and Radar  wait eagerly for the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Colonel Blake here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. GENERAL HAMMOND'S OFFICE, 325 EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY HAMMOND, a one-star general, has a major and a lieutenant colonel with him as he talks to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I got news for you, Henry. You've  been so concerned about that battle  for Old Baldy. It's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HENRY'S OFFICE – DAY Henry nods happily to the others to tell them that the wo is favorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Thanks, General. Thanks for calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and turns to the others to pass on the Genera exact words. INT. GENERAL HAMMOND'S OFFICE, 325 EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY The General wasn't through talking and didn't expect Henr to hang up at that point. He is quite startled, in fact,  because he has been saving the most important piece of  information for the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to major and  lieutenant colonel) He didn't wait to hear who won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FIELD NEAR RIVERBANK – DAY A very hot day in late August. Standing all by itself in empty field is a sign on which some fairly careful carpen and lettering work has been expended. It reads: "38TH PAR

dialogues.speaker: MEDICAL SOCIETY MEETS HERE SUNDAYS."
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS to the river, where Trapper, Hawkeye and Duke are lying on their stomachs, naked or nearly so, on air  mattresses. The heat from which they seek relief is obvio intense, and they are pampering themselves further with t ice-filled drinks. On the riverbank near them stands one  empty cup and one half-full bottle of Pimms No. 1 Cup, an all three surgeons are more noticeably drunk than we have previously seen them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
