dialogues.text: She had this shiny black hair piled  up on her head, but later on she let  it hang loose and I'll be damned if  it didn't come all the way down to  her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always had a hankering for blonde  pussy myself. My wife's hair is a  wonderful golden yellow, and this  time of year it gets even lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's why you go for Hot  Lips Houlihan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know damn well I nearly puke  when I look at her. I don't even  think she's a real blonde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say a thing like that  about an officer in the United States  Army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I not only say it, I'll back it up  twenty buck's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got yourself a bet, Georgia boy. (to Trapper) You're a witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm a witness, but how do you  prove who's right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. SHOWER TENT – NIGHT Twelve hours later. The shower tent is simply an ordinary Army tent enclosing a row of showers supplied by a water  tank on a high platform in back of the tent. Duke and Haw are working under cover of darkness to loosen each of the stakes that secures the tent to the ground around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. THE SWAMP – DAY The following afternoon. Trapper and Hawkeye sit in chair outside their tent, glasses in hand, still on their tall, hot-weather drink kick. Trapper looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's five minutes into nurses' shower  hour. Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MASH COMPOUND – DAY The Swamp is at the end of the officers' row nearest the  nurses' tents, so they have a good view of the women as t emerge from their quarters dressed in bathrobes and carry towels, shower caps and bars of soap. The first two to ap are Knocko and Lieutenant Scorch. Next, from her own priv tent, comes Hot Lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Knocko, I got those pictures  you promised to look at of my kids.  You too, Wilma. It won't take a  minute. (to Hot Lips politely) You can see them too, if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. I'm not the slightest  bit interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues on across the compound and enters the showe tent. Knocko and Lieutenant Scorch come over to the Swamp while Hawkeye goes inside to find the pictures. Then two more n emerge from a tent and head for the showers. Trapper gets and saunters over to intercept them. EXT. SHOWER TENT – DAY The door of the tent is closed behind Hot Lips, and after moment there is the sound of water being turned on. Then attention is drawn to the peak of the tent, to which a th scarcely visible strand of wire has been attached. The wi is drawn taut and runs across the peak of the barbershop  tent next door and down the far side of it to where Duke  sits on the ground operating a sort of windlass upon whic the wire is wound. He turns the crank with a quick burst energy. Back at the shower tent the force of the wire pulls the c tight, the loosened stakes come out of the ground, and th whole tent is whisked right off its center pole, revealin Hot Lips nude under the shower. EXT. BARBERSHOP TENT – DAY Duke abandons his machine and moves to where he can get t crucial view of Hot Lips. The he calls across the compoun to Hawkeye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Yankee know-it-all! Pay up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HENRY'S TENT – DAY Hot Lips, in her robe, her hair still wet from the shower carrying her towel and shower cap, is expressing her wrat forcefully to Henry, ignoring the facts that he is in bed and that Leslie is in bed with him, which explains why we have never seen anybody make a pass at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a hospital, it's an insane  asylum! And it's your fault because  you don't do anything to discourage  them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you expect me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them under arrest! See what a  courtmartial thinks of their drunken  hooliganism. It started with their  calling me Hot Lips and your letting  them get away with it. You let them  get away with everything! And if you  don't turn them over to the MPs now,  I'm going to resign my commission  and...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, g-g-goddamit, Hot Lips, resign  your ggodam c-commission!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FRONT OF 4077TH MASH – NIGHT Two days later. An Army car bearing the single star of a  brigadier general drives up to the entrance. The sergeant the wheel jumps out and open the rear door for General Ha and his aide, a captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to aide) Tell them I want to talk to all the  officers on the post except those on  emergency duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MESS HALL – NIGHT Most of the officers of 4077th Mash are assembled to list to General Hammond. Henry and Hot Lips are both in the fr row but separated by some distance and not looking at eac other. All the Swampmen are on hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...These are very serious accusations,  and without prejudging the charges  against him, I am suspending Colonel  Blake from all his duties during the  investigation, which I will conduct  myself. I will also serve as your  Commanding Officer during that time.  I shall be calling on a number of  you for your individual testimony on  the points at issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Carry on. INT. DENTAL CLINIC – NIGHT Hawkeye, Duke and Painless are playing poker with a Briti a Norwegian and an Australian officer. It is close to two o'clock the same night. General Hammond opens the door an looks in, doesn't like what he sees and steps inside. All six players are immediately aware of his presence but dec to act as if they weren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to British Officer,  who is dealing) Gimme three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At ease. Captain Pierce, you have a  seriously wounded patient for whom  you are responsible. Yet I find you  in a poker game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betcher ass, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One to the dealer. (to Hawkeye) You're the opener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce! That soldier requires  immediate attention. I'm a surgeon  and I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betcher ass, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wager a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye and the Australian throw in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to take care of your  patient or are you going to play  poker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King-high flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Painless and the Norwegian throw in their hands, and the  Englishman pulls in the pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the general) I'm going to play poker until three  a.m. or until the patient is ready  for surgery. However, if you'd like  to operate on him yourself right  now, be my guest. I get the same  dough whether I work or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you, Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to talk about,  General. You take the case yourself  or join me at three o'clock. Either  way you're liable to learn something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General is far from pleased with the disrespect accor him, but as the poker players start a new hand, he decide against making an issue on terms selected by Hawkeye. Ins he turns around and goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Ugly John is attending a Korean soldier on the operating  table with a belly wound. The OR clock reveals that the t is 2:55. Hawkeye and Seidman look in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's practically there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Seidman) Please ask General Hammond to join  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SURGEONS' WASH-UP ROOM – NIGHT General Hammond joins Hawkeye at the scrub sink, prepared take part in the coming operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, at one-thirty when I checked  him last, this guy had had less than  a pint of blood, and he'd lost two  or three. His pulse then was 120 and  his blood pressure was about 90.  Now, at three o'clock, he's had three  pints of blood. His pulse is 80 and  his pressure 120. His collapsed lung  has been expanded and he's had a  gram of terramycin intravenously. We  can operate on him safely and we  should do it quickly, but we don't  have to do it frantically or  carelessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Hawkeye has been doing the repair work in the patient's b with General Hammond functioning as a largely nonparticip assistant. The incision is still open with sections of bowel on whic repairs have been done still exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, General, I'm going to sandbag  you. Do you think we're ready to get  out of this belly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously you don't think so, and I  don't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dad, we haven't found any holes  in the large bowel. They've all been  in the small bowel, but the smell is  different. I caught a whiff of large  bowel, but it ain't staring us in  the face, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if it ain't staring us in the  face, it's got to be retroperitoneal.  And that, along with the look of the  wounds, makes me figure he's got a  hole in his sigmoid colon that we  won't find unless we look for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has been working all the time he has been talking, and now, after a little more manipulation within the incision is able to indicate the perforation he has hypothecated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed, Pierce. Naturally,  the kind of job I have, I don't get  much chance to keep up with what  goes on in the OR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither does Henry Blake. But I'll  tell you what makes him the best  C.O. you've got in any of your  hospitals. He leaves all the medical  decisions to the men who do the day- to-day work and understand what  meatball surgery is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. THE SWAMP – DAY The following day. General Hammond is having a drink with Hawkeye, Trapper and Duke. Ho-Jon keeps the glasses full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It certainly isn't Henry's fault Hot  Lips Houlihan doesn't like her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or her figger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's so square she's even against  our having a football team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stirs the General's curiosity, but Duke speaks befor he has a chance to ask his question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think we'd be speaking up  for a goddam Regular Army colonel,  do you, if it wasn't important?  Begging your pardon, General. I  forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye) Football?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody you replaced Henry with  couldn't last. We guarantee that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you had a football  team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's still pretty much in the  talk stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a team at the 325th Evac last  fall. I coached the boys myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I heard about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're working out a schedule of  the outfits we're going to play this  year. We all chip into a pool and  make bets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be fun. But the point we want  to make about Henry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) I'm sure we could find a date for  your team. Why don't I take it up  with Henry? (exiting) Thanks for the drink, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the General has left, the other two Swampmen look a Hawkeye uncomprehendingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell we going to get us a  football team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three of us played for our  schools. And there are at least four  other guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's got five times the man-power  to draw on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can balance that by getting  ourselves a ringer. Henry has to say  he needs a neurosurgeon and put in a  specific request for Dr. Oliver Harmon  Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you have, only as 'Spearchucker'  Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nigra boy with the Philadelphia  Eagles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only lasted one season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On account he got caught in the doctor  draft. He was a surgical resident  playing semi-pro ball weekends when  the Eagles signed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come nobody knows about him? And  you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked with Spearchucker my first  month over here, at the 72nd Evac in  Taegu. Most of the colored guys know  who he is but they're not talking  because he asked them not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what makes you think he'll play  for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll cut him in on the bets we make.  And still have enough profit to send  Ho-Jon to college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might make kind of a social issue,  not having any other Negro officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can move in here with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute, Hawkeye. I come a  long way, learning to put up with a  couple of crazy Yankees, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me about your problems,  boy. Explain them to Ho-Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HENRY'S OFFICE – DAY Henry, nervous at what he thinks is going to be his showd with General Hammond, is startled by the General's unexpe proposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we had closer relations, there  wouldn't be any misunderstandings.  That's where a football game would  help. Between your outfit and mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A football game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Services in Tokyo are all  for it. They say it's one of the  main gimmicks we have to keep the  American way of life going here in  Asia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about Major Houlihan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Hot Lips? Screw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-n-no thanks, G-General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. LANDING AREA OUTSIDE 4077TH MASH – DAY It is September. A helicopter descends to the ground in t familiar location and, as on earlier occasions, Medical  Corpsmen come from the hospital to aid in unloading it. B this time the cargo, instead of wounded men, turns out to boxes which the corpsmen rip open and which contains foot uniforms: black shoes, cardinal red jerseys, white helmet and white pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FIELD BEHIND OFFICERS' LATRINE – DAY A day or two later. Fifteen men are wearing uniforms from the chopper load. Practice at this point is confined to  kicking and passing the three footballs at their disposal and the uniforms still look clean and new. Trapper is a g passer, Hawkeye is a better-than-average receiver, and Du punts well, but generally speaking, the balls are dropped more often than they are caught, and the overall effect i pretty ragged. Among the other players are Vollmer, Ugly  John, Boone, Painless and Judson. On the sidelines watchi are Henry, with a whistle tied to a piece of rubber hospi tubing around his neck, and, in uniform, SPEARCHUCKER, a  very big, broad-shouldered black man in his early thirtie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can make a suggestion, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I run an organization, any  man in it has the right to speak his  mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, here are ten basic  plays. I think that's about all this  bunch can handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Henry ten sheets of paper, on each of which a ru or pass play is diagrammed down to the finest detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Spearchucker. I'll  certainly take a look at these. Where  the hell did you ever get that name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to throw the javelin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye catches a pass from Trapper and runs with the bal right to where Henry and Spearchucker are standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, we look pretty lousy out  there, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for college players that have  been out of training seven or eight  years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking about how we can make  more money. (to Henry) Suppose we bet only part of our dough  and keep this big animal out of the  game the whole first half and let  them roll up some points. Then you  could bet the rest of our bundle  between the halves and get the General  and his friends to give us some real  odds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a nice idea. I mean it has style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way we can make enough  to put Ho-Jon through Androscoggin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD, 325TH EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY It is November. The Mash team, in uniform, comes out of t quonset hut assigned to it as dressing quarters. Already the bench toward which the players head are a few support including Dago Red, Knocko and Leslie. Radar is also ther serving as water boy. Spearchucker has a blanket wrapped over his head and held together at the chin to eliminate the chance of his being recognized as he looks over their opponents, who now file out of their quonset hut. The first notable thing about them is that they number tw five as opposed to a total of fifteen in uniform for the  Mash team. Second is the even more discouraging fact that two of the one black and one white are enormous, bigger than  Spearchucker. The uniforms are orange and black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those two big guys were tackles on  the Cleveland Browns, and the redhead  played halfback with the Rams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't do that to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bastards outconned us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we could still have a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you start the game instead of  waiting, you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let's stick to that strategy  till we see whether you boys can do  two things. The first is get that  halfback out of the game. He had one  year with the Rams before the Army  got him, but he didn't play too often  because he's one of those hot dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he sees a little running room,  he likes to make a show... you know,  stutter steps and cross-overs and  all that jazz. Also he never learned  to button up when he gets hit, so if  you two can get a good shot at him  once, you can hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we'd have to break his leg or  something to keep him out of the  game for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as there's a pile-up, we can  do our bit to encourage his permanent  withdrawal from the contest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a technique Ugly John and I  worked out in case something like  this came up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gazing across at  opposition tackles) Look at the size of those two beasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I could hurt one of  them with a sledgehammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can make them run. They've got  the occupational disease of oversized  ex-athletes. They're carrying thirty  pounds extra apiece. So we run  everything wide, wide, wide... make  them move more then they want to on  every play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD, 325TH EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY The Mash team is lined up to kick off, which is Duke's  function. There is only one official, a REFEREE, dressed in convent white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pro halback is playing safety.  Kick it to anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke accordingly kicks the ball about thirty yards and an to his left. But the player who takes it on the thirty-ya line simply runs to his left and back a little toward his own goal line in order to hand it to the RAM HALFBACK as charges downfield from his safety position. He sidesteps, straight-arms or otherwise eludes all eleven of the Mash  players and runs unimpeded for a touchdown. A few moments later he kicks the ball over the bar for the point after  touchdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming from  sidelines) Stop him! Stop that man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they line up to  receive) Sure, you just blindfold him first  and tie him to a stake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke is the one to receive the kickoff, which he takes on the ten. He runs it back about twenty yards, dodging several enemy tacklers, then sees the black tackle from Cleveland beari down on him. Duke runs back and forth sideways a few time not gaining any ground but making the other man move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws a lateral pass to Hawkeye, toward whom both tac from Cleveland now run. Hawkeye leads them almost from on side of the field to the other, then reverses direction,  keeping them on the move till he sees a chance to throw a lateral to Trapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the bench) That's the stuff! Run the hams off  those big hogs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapper returns the ball to Duke, who manages to make a c of yards forward and a lot more sideways before the Ram  halfback cuts him down from the rear. The Mash team goes  into its first huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to huddle) Okay, don't give them a chance to  get their breath. Hawkeye wide to  the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are near the sideline to their left, playing a winge formation. Trapper takes the ball from Vollmer, the cente runs back as if to pass but really gives it to Hawkeye at left half as Hawkeye goes by him in a wide sweep that tak him all the way to the right sideline with the two Clevel tackles in pursuit. Hawkeye then cuts in quick and tries to get by them but o of them brings him down for a gain of no more than two ya On the next play Trapper really goes back to pass, but hi blockers are of no use against the pro tackles, whom he s descending on him. Trapper starts running straight back f a while, then makes a dash to the right followed by a das to the left. He is almost tackled again, and his only rou of escape is back toward his own goal line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the sideline) Throw it! Throw it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faced with a loss of about twenty-five yards, Trapper spo Hawkeye in the area of the line of scrimmage and whips th ball to him. Hawkeye catches it but there are tacklers all around him he goes down almost immediately for no gain on the play.  Moving faster than they have to in order not to give the  opposition any rest, the team huddles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to huddle) Wide to the left. Duke, you're the  pacesetter this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go into action again. This time Trapper, taking the  ball from Vollmer, gives it to Duke, who makes a feint at off-tackle play, then turns back and into a wide end run  instead. Duke is still a good ball carrier by college  standards and he has little trouble shaking off the amate who try to tackle him, and is thus able to make it a runn duel with the professionals. When they finally nab him, h is no more than two or three yards ahead of the scrimmage line, but the ex-tackles from Cleveland are visibly panti and wishing they hadn't allowed all that extra poundage t accumulate. On the fourth down, of course, they have to p Duke goes back to receive the ball from Vollmer at center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to get it far down. Kick  it up high so we can get there and  surround that son-ofa-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, if I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does a good job of it. The kick is high enough so ther are several red jerseys around the Ram halfback when he g under it. He raises his right arm for a fair catch. The would-be Ma tacklers, including Hawkeye and Trapper are frustrated. T array themselves defensively while their opponents have a huddle and line up to take the offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Duke and Trapper) Let's get him this time. I don't  think they've got anyone else who  can carry the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hawkeye anticipated, the opposing quarterback slips th ball to the Ram halfback, who starts to go wide of the ta sees Hawkeye, untouched by blockers, closing in from the  outside, and makes his beautiful cross-over to cut back i At the same time he is hit at the knees by Hawkeye, and h by Duke. And there are quite a few other Mash players in immediate vicinity, Trapper and Ugly John in the forefron so that a lot of weight is piled up on top of the flashy  halfback. A close look at Ugly John reveals him to be reaching insi his jersey and under a shoulder pad, from which he extrac a hypodermic needle. With the skill of an expert  anesthesiologist he pulls up the sleeve of the tackled an stunned halfback, and plunges the needle into his arm. The Referee meanwhile is indignantly pulling at the Mash  players on top of the pile and orally expressing his  disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off the guy! He's tackled. You  don't all need to jump on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mash players quickly remove themselves. Duke and Hawk are the last to get up. Remaining on the ground is the fo halfback for the Rams, still firmly clutching the ball bu looking as if he needed to get a lot of air into his lung His captain, the white pro tackle, takes one look at him speaks to the Referee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time! Time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Referee blows his whistle to stop the clock. The capt waves for assistance from the sidelines, and the trainer water boy come running in. Radar also appears from the  opposite sideline with water for his team. Ugly John take advantage of his presence to slip the hypodermic he has b concealing in his hand into Radar's pocket. Meanwhile there is agreement in the opposition camp that Ram halfback should go out of the game for a while to res up. A couple of his teammates assist him to the bench. Th Mash players observe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's taken care of. Scratch  one hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think we hurt him that  bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no, all you did was knock the  wind out of him. But he won't be  playing any more football today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. 325TH EVAC TEAM'S DRESSING ROOM – DAY It is between the halves and the General's players are  resting, especially the ex-Cleveland tackles, who are  stretched out prone. General Hammond and his TRAINER (a medical Corps Captain) are concentrating on the ex-Los Angeles halfback, who sit on a table looking groggy. Henry sticks his head in the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ram halfback) The Trainer has to assist the man,  and the moment he lets go of him,  the halfback crumples to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting out again) Sorry. You obviously won't be wanting  any more bets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell we won't! You bastards pulled  something, I don't know what, but  we've been beating you without him.  Ane we'll go on beating you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You willing to b-back that up with  odds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right. Three to one, as much as  you want to put up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD, 325TH EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY The two teams have taken the field again. Hawkeye has swi to left end, Spearchucker replacing him in the backfield. This time General Hammond's men are kicking off to Henry' It's a long kick but it doesn't go toward the center of t goal line, where Spearchucker is waiting for it, but to D who runs toward Spearchucker and tosses him an easy later The two pro tackles from the Browns run down the field so to converge on Spearchucker around the Mash twenty-five. the other Mash players divide themselves into equal units five to do nothing but take out the two tackles. The othe opposing players are no problem for Spearchucker, who run around or right through them, and crosses their goal line for a touchdown. The ball is brought out for the extra po which Duke scores with a place kick. Before the teams  reassemble for the next kickoff, the captain of the 325th team detours a few yards toward his bench and calls somet to General Hammond, whose reaction is to stand up and sha his fist in Henry's direction. On the Mash bench, Radar l over to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Hammond, sir, has just been  informed about the identity of Captain  Jones. His ringers recognized our  ringer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the field Duke is preparing to kick off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spearchucker) What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may be in trouble, I can't catch  my breath. I've got the occupational  disease of oversized ex-athletes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ATHLETIC FIELD, 325TH EVAC HOSPITAL – DAY Spearchucker is trying to block or intercept a forward pa but the two tackles from Cleveland still have enough stre left to put him out of action with their combined efforts They block him so forcibly, in fact, that he drops to the ground and has some trouble getting up. The pass is compl and the receiver tackled on the Mash thirty-five yard lin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timeout! (to Referee as latter  blows whistle) How much left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minute and twenty-five seconds. And  that's a first down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar comes out to the Mash huddle with his water-bucket towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to stop them right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And get ourselves another touchdown  to win. (looking to opponents'  huddle) I wish to hell we knew what they  were plotting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting an idea) Radar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you have to do is ask. (concentrates on the  huddle twelve yards  away) The quarterback is saying they'll  run the old Statue of Liberty. Their  left end will come across and take  the ball out of his hand and try to  get around our left end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's talking at once, but now  the captain is telling them to shut  up. The quarterback says, if the  Statue of Liberty doesn't work,  they'll go into the double wing with  the left halfback taking the handoff  first and then slipping it to the  right halfback heading to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Referee blows the whistle and the two teams line up t resume action. The 325th Evac quarterback drops back as i to pass, his left end starts to his right, and the whole  Mash eleven starts to their left. Only Ugly John finds hi temporarily buried under a 265-pound tackle. The other te men in red meet the enemy left end after he takes the bal off the quarterback's hand, and they bring him down for a loss. The opposing team goes into another huddle but thei strategy remains as Radar overheard it. When the left hal starts to his right, the Mash players start to their righ and after the right halfback takes over possession and tr to turn in, he finds himself hopelessly outnumbered.  Spearchucker hits him first with a tackle so fierce it th him back five yards and induces him to fumble the ball. A pile of half a dozen MASH players pounces on it, causing  some damage to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Referee) Time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes over to the Referee and exchanges a few words wit him, then walks into his team's huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spearchucker) You got to be the one. We're all  agreed on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's too far and we're all too  bushed. I just told the referee we're  going to try something different. We  make the center eligible by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I can't catch a pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to. We line up with  everybody to the right of center  except Hawkeye, who drops back a  yard just before the snap. At the  same time Duke moves to the right  side of the line. (to Vollmer) That makes you eligible but all you  have to do is take the ball right  back from Trapper between your legs  and hide it under your belly. Trapper,  you make like you got the ball, fake  to me and keep going. One of the big  guys will hit you, maybe both...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I only got my GI insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vollmer) As soon as that happens, Sergeant,  you start walking, not running to  their goal line. Remember that, don't  run! Come on, we just got time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break out of the huddle and line up as directed, wit all the linemen except Hawkeye on Vollmer's right. Their  opponents have trouble adjusting to this and are even mor confused when, just as Trapper bends down to take the bal from Vollmer, Hawkeye steps back into the backfield and D squeezes into the already crowded right line. Returning t ball to Vollmer, Trapper turns his back, fakes a pitchout Spearchucker, who is racing toward the line, and continue backward, holding himself as if he still had the ball and were fading for a long pass. So successfully does he crea this impression that the two tackles from Cleveland, seei clearly that Spearchucker hasn't received the ball, desce on Trapper with their last burst of energy. Two other ora and-black linemen also fall on top of him. Meanwhile, Vol holding his arms crossed under his stomach to further hid the ball, and looking as if her were suffering from a pai blow beneath the belt, starts walking down the field at a angle toward his own sideline, making the opposition thin he is heading for the bench to seek relief from his injur Spearchucker stops running at about the enemy thirty, loo back to where Trapper's tacklers are beginning to remove  themselves, but also notes out of the corner of his eye t only the opposing safety man is anywhere near Vollmer and that he isn't paying much attention to him. From the bench a frantic Henry looks indignantly at the s of his center and Sergeant Major coming off the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? What the hell are  you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his arms enough for Henry to see the pigskin cra there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then run for God's sake! Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vollmer begins to run straight toward the goal line, whic has the unfortunate effect of alerting the safety man to  what is happening. He races across the field to cut Vollmer off. Spearchucke starts into motion at the same instant and gets down ther so fast that just as the safety man is tackling Vollmer i way that would throw him out of bounds on the two-yard li Spearchucker hurls himself against the safety man with a  strong and well-aimed block that sends both men across th goal line. General Hammond runs onto the field in vehement protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illegal! Illegal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Referee, looking at his watch and raising his Army .4 to signal the end of the game, goes over to meet the Gene and explain the sad truth to him. INT. MASH TEAM'S DRESSING ROOM – DAY Some of the players are partly undressed but most of them are too exhausted to begin that process. Trapper is stret out on a bench, apparently unconscious. Henry enters  triumphantly, waving a thick stack of paper money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it, men... Ho-Jon's keep as  Androscoggin... if there is such a  place. And the big news is, the  General wants a rematch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you my news. I'm retiring  from football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. Y'all just seen me play my  last game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here. You can retire my number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's one big satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I out-coached that General Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. FRONT OF 4077TH MASH – EVENING A covered Army truck pulls up with the victorious footbal team breaking the normal rule for hospital zones by singi a boisterous old drinking song. Several of them have bott in their hands as they descend to the ground. Hawkeye and Duke are among the first and the noisiest until they noti Lapham (the new surgeon we saw the first time during the  deluge) standing under the light at the hospital entrance There is something in his expression that makes them brea off their singing abruptly. Trapper and Spearchucker, jum down after them, react the same way, and their sudden sil affects the others so that in a matter of seconds the sin has died out entirely. Hawkeye and Duke run toward the  hospital entrance, Trapper and Spearchucker a little behi them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. AT HO-JON'S BEDSIDE – EVENING Ho-Jon is unconscious. Lapham holds an X-ray while Trappe scans it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a massive one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The X-ray is passed on to Hawkeye, Duke and Spearchucker turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't he awful young...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the artery we sewed up last  summer. Had to end up smaller, that  much easier for the thrombosis to  occur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon opens his eyes, slowly reacting to the pressure of all the doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain bad, Ho-Jon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with considerable  effort) I – wouldn't – wish – it – on – a –  maneating – shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lapham) More demerol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lapham goes off to get the medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You – must – open – me – up – again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Ho-Jon, we're not going to open  you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke's words are intentionally ambiguous, and when Ho-Jon looks from one doctor to another to find the real meaning them, they all try not to reveal it. But he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DENTAL CLINIC – DAY Hawkeye and Trapper are in a stud poker game along with  Painless, Vollmer, Radar, a helicopter pilot and the Norw Officer we saw playing before. There is an entrance to th hospital visible through a window, and an ambulance is pa outside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pair of sevens'll say a buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance driver and another soldier come out of the  hospital bearing a shrouded corpse on a stretcher. Hawkey choosing not to call the bet, turns over his cards, stand up restlessly and sees the body on the stretcher. Trapper who has a view out the window from the seat, also sees it and the effect on him is to take his attention momentaril from the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter pilot folds his hand, and it's Trapper's t to be next. Radar, who is dealing, waits a moment to see he has to be reminded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dollars to you, Trapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-Jon's body is tossed into the back of the ambulance.  Trapper checks his cards and turns them over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MASH COMPOUND – NIGHT Three months later, a cold winter night with snow on the  ground. Hawkeye, in a heavy sweater, is running toward the bright lit hospital. INT. OPERATING ROOM – NIGHT Spearchucker is doing a brain operation with Duke assisti Hawkeye comes in excitedly but stops within a few feet of the operating table because he isn't sterile. He grabs a  surgical mask and holds it in front of his face as he spe to Duke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's got our orders! We're going  home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time. Whenever we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind if we get out of this guy's  brain first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there to do? You found the  sliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There might be another tiny piece we  missed. I want to look around before  we close up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hawkeye, referring  to Spearchucker) Perfectionist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works the retractor he is holding to spread the incisi while Spearchucker probes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no transportation anyway  this time of night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could steal one of the choppers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked. Suspicious bastards got  them all locked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. THE SWAMP – DAY The next day, snow still on the ground. Ugly John is at t wheel of a Jeep into which Hawkeye and Duke are storing t same Valpacs and barracks bags they arrived with more tha year before. There is a small group gathered to say goodb including Dago Red, Lapham and Vollmer, who is Regular Ar but none of the others who were part of the outfit when t first arrived. When they are all ready to take off, Hawke and Duke go back inside the Swamp. INT. THE SWAMP – DAY Trapper is drunk and gloomy, Spearchucker in fairly good  spirits. Duke pours small drinks into three glasses and adds some the drink Trapper is already holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all mind the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four goddam months. And they don't  even give you time off for good  behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands with  Spearchucker) See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending hand to  Trapper) Hang in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you for Christ's sake get  the hell out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's what they proceed to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. JAPANESE SEAPORT DOCK – DAY A couple of days later. Hawkeye and Duke are inspecting t troopship on which they will make the long voyage to Seat They have undergone a startling transformation: they have had shaves and haircuts, and they have abandoned their  fatigues for clean, new-looking uniforms with Eisenhower  jackets adorned with their proper insignia, including a  caduceus of the Medical Corps. There is a lot of activity board the ship and on the dock, where a MEDICAL CORPS SER with a notebook accosts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gentlemen, but are you  sailing on the troopship tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have your names, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need medical officers for short- arm inspection starting the first  afternoon out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, certainly, Sergeant. My name is  Captain George Limburger, and this  is Captain Walter Camembert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing) C-A-M-E-M...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-E-R-T, right. See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not sailing with you. I work  out of the hospital here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He salutes them and goes on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating his  shoulder insignia) I thought we were heading for trouble  putting on all these trinkets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to start rehabilitating, Duke,  if we want to be halfway human by  the time we get back to our wives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But no short-arm inspection. I'm  with you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw it. We been earning our keep  as respectable knife artists. Why  should we do work any pill-rolling  punk could handle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. HARBOR – DAY The big troopship is making its way out of the harbor and heading for open ocean. EXT. TROOPSHIP – DAY A SECOND MEDICAL CORPS SERGEANT walks along the deck at t officers' end of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Limburger! Captain Camembert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he gets in response are funny looks and laughter. By time he comes near where Hawkeye and Duke are standing, t Sergeant is beginning to wonder if there is something pec about the names he is calling. For added protection Hawke and Duke have replaced their Medical Corps insignia with simple cross of the Chaplain's Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Camembert! Captain Camembert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Reverend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want with those two  medical officers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're supposed to hold short-arm  inspection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be serious, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason they're being shipped  home is they're the two biggest  fairies in the Far East Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be the longest short-arm inspection  you ever held!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Reverend. Thank you both for  tipping me off. (consulting list) You don't know a Captain Forrest or  a Captain Pierce, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They missed the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making a note) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Segeant goes off in one direction, Duke and Hawkeye i another. Pretty soon they come across a dice game and stop to watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This a closed game or you take  anybody's dough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of the DICE PLAYERS look up and react adversely the Chaplain's Corps insignia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, almost anybody's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetically, to  Duke) Kind of a rough game, Reverend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, man, that don't matter. We're  loaded. We were big wheels in the  black market in Seoul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus running the opium concession  for the whole Eighth Army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These confessions arouse the interest of all the players. One, a SIGNAL CORPS CAPTAIN, looks at them intently, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not chaplains at all. They're  doctors from the 4077th Mash. I had  a piece of steel dug out of my back  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The player who told them it was a rough game, an infantry captain, extends his hand to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure to have you. Lot of my men  went through your outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to know you. Listen, we're  ducking short-arm inspection but our  cover isn't going to last long. How  would you two boys like to do us a  favor? Be Forrest and Pierce of the  Medical Corps between here and  Seattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't know how to go about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to it. You just turn a chair  around backwards and rest your chin  on the top. You sit there with a big  cigar in your mouth and and every  now and then, just to show you're  looking, you say, 'Don't wave it so  close to my cigar, soldier.' That's  all you do. You can't go wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. U.S. CIVILIAN AIRLINER – NIGHT It is March. A STEWARDESS with a stern look approaches Du and Hawkeye. Duke is sucking on a bottle of scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've told you twice to put away that  bottle. Now I'll have to ask the  captain to come back and speak to  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind your captain, honey. (takes bottle from  Duke and puts it  away) I'll take care of mine. Till we land  in Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MEN'S ROOM – MIDWAY AIRPORT – CHICAGO – NIGHT The bottle of scotch stands on a shelf over the wash basi Duke is combing his hair, Hawkeye shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker  system) Flight 616 for Cincinnati, Knoxville  and Atlanta, now boarding at Gate  Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye reaches for the bottle, hands it to Duke, who tak a sip and passes it back. Hawkeye kills it and throws it  into a trash can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear from you, you goddam  Yankee. Be nice to see you some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the Spearchucker said, that's  possible. Anyway, it's been an  interesting association.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke picks up his bags and starts out. Hawkeye resumes  shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ATLANTA AIRPORT – DAY Duke is among the passengers entering the airport from an incoming flight. He spots his wife and two daughters, now three and one-and-a-half. He starts eagerly toward them b we never get a distinct look at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ROCKLAND, MAINE AIRPORT – DAY Here incoming passengers can be met outside the terminal  building. Hawkeye disembarks from a Northeast Airlines Convair and  sees his wife waiting for him with their sons, aged five three. The older one lets go his mother's hand, dashes ou to his father and jumps into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How they goin', Hawkeye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finest kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks toward his wife, but we don't see her in clear f
